Sentence: ROME, Sept. 28 (Xinhua) -- Financial markets were on their heels Friday, a day after Italy's populist, anti-establishment government announced it would widen its budget deficit in order to finance costly electoral promises.
Label: Main

Sentence: Thursday's blueprint says the government would widen the 2019 budget deficit to an estimated 2.4 percent of the gross domestic product, almost surely putting the country on a collision course with the European Union (EU).
Label: Main

Sentence: The EU has called for Italy to focus on paying down the government's deficit, the highest in the bloc in absolute terms and the second highest when measured as a percentage of gross domestic product.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: The 2.4-percent figure is around three times higher than the estimates put forward by the previous government, which ended its term May 31.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: It is also far above the 1.6-perfect figure promised by Minister of Finance Giovanni Tria.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Still, it is below the more than 3.0-percent deficit the government said it wanted in August.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Tria, a political independent not associated with either of the political parties backing the Giuseppe Conte government, reportedly vowed to resign if he lost the battle over the budget.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: There were no immediate signs Tria would follow through with his threat on Friday, but the Italian media reported it could still happen.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: In absolute terms, the difference between Tria's 1.6-perfect deficit promise and the 2.4-percent target announced Thursday is around 175 billion euros (205 billion U.S. dollars) in extra spending.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: That figure is more than the gross domestic products of 15 of the 28 EU member states, including Greece, the only EU country more indebted than Italy.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Italy has the third largest economy in the 19-nation euro currency union.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Luigi Di Maio, Italy's minister of labor and the head of the Five-Star Movement, said the extra spending would pay for itself through higher economic growth.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: "We must explain to markets that there are so many smart investments inside this 2.4-percent figures that we will be able to grow the economy as much as we want to," Di Maio said in a press conference.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: But analysts were less convinced.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: "Before the figure was announced I thought that Tria's 1.6-percent figure was not likely, but that 2.4 or above would mean outright war with the European Union," Riccardo Puglisi, a political economist with the University of Pavia, told Xinhua.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: "At close to 2.0-percent, it would have been a skirmish.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: But 2.4 percent is bad news."
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Ugo Arrigo, an economics and statistics professor with Bicocca University in Milan, said the decision was likely based on politics and not economics.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: "Really, the deficit should have been 1.6 or 1.7 percent," Arrigo said in an interview.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: "Above 2 is trouble because it means the government is putting electoral promises above sustainability."
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Among the costly promises put forth by the four-month-old government: a universal basic income for all Italian citizens, an earlier retirement age for workers, and a flat tax for Italian companies.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: The spending measures alone are expected to add at least 100 billion euros to the deficit.

Sentence: Financial markets responded badly to the news: both because of the fiscal implications of the 2019 budget and the likelihood it could ultimately destabilize the government, especially if Tria stepped down.

Sentence: In trading Friday, the first session after the latest developments, bond yields surged as much as 12 percent higher, reaching a yield of 3.35 percent in midday trading for the benchmark ten-year bonds.

Sentence: That is approaching their highest yield since 2014.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Higher yields for bonds reflect investor nervousness, and they increase the government's costs when it borrows money.

Sentence: MANILA, Sept. 4 (Xinhua) -- The Asian Development Bank (ADB) launched on Tuesday its first Trade Finance Scorecard, a new tool to address market gaps stemming from the unintended consequences of global measures to fight money-laundering and terrorism.
Label: Main

Sentence: "Preventing criminals and terrorists from exploiting the global financial system is critically important," said ADB's Head of Trade and Supply Chain Finance Steven Beck.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: "But these regulations can also undermine jobs and growth at small businesses and developing countries.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: This new scorecard will open a channel of dialogue among stakeholders to help prevent crime and terrorism while financing growth and job creation," Beck said.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: The ADB said the Trade Finance Scorecard focuses on issues related to the interpretation, implementation, and compliance with regulations designed to curb money laundering and the financing of terrorism in the context of correspondent banking and trade financing.

Sentence: "The scores are assigned on two levels.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Firstly, at a macro level, to identify characteristics of effective regulation that could be strengthened.

Sentence: Secondly, at a micro transactional level, to highlight specific challenges that can be addressed in the shorter term," the ADB said.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: The ADB added "Elements of effective regulation outlined in the first level are scored out of 10 on seven criteria: consistency (4), risk alignment (3), design (2), stakeholder communication (5), technology and data (5), enforcement (4), and quality control (3).

Sentence: These criteria are used to assess five working-level issues in the second level."

Sentence: The ADB said the scorecard is based on feedback from industry leaders and regulators and will complement existing tools such as the Financial Action Task Force's recommendations against money laundering and terrorist financing.

Sentence: BEIJING, Sept. 12 (Xinhua) -- China will roll out the decoupling of business licenses and operation permits as a nationwide program starting this November, and further cut production permits for industrial goods by over one third in an effort to ease corporate burdens, the State Council's executive meeting chaired by Premier Li Keqiang decided on Wednesday.
Label: Main

Sentence: The Chinese government places high importance on the reform of decoupling business licenses and operation permits, which are both required for starting business operations, as an important step in fostering a law-based, enabling business environment up to international standards.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Premier Li Keqiang stressed the imperative to advance this reform, making it clear at the plenary session of the National People's Congress last March that the reform will be introduced nationwide this year.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: He put particular emphasis on resolving the problem of companies being unable to operate even after they have received business licenses.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: This reform was piloted late 2015 in the Pudong New Area of Shanghai, targeting 116 items of administrative approval.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: It was later implemented in all of Shanghai.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: It was pointed out at the Wednesday meeting that introducing the decoupling nationwide constitutes a key step in implementing the broader reform of government functions.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: The reform will help improve the business environment, energize the market and catalyze stronger development.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: "Decoupling business licenses and operation permits is the right way to go, as it meets both corporate and public needs.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: It is a necessary part of the reform of our market economy system, and a step we must take," Li said.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: The Wednesday meeting announced that starting from November 10 this year, an approach of reduced number of required permits and certificates after receiving business licenses will be applied nationwide to the first batch of some 100 business-related government approval items.
Label: Main

Sentence: Items that are no longer necessary for administrative approval or are eligible for self-improvement through market forces will become approval-free or require registration only.
Label: Main

Sentence: The practice of notification commitment shall be applied to those government review items that need to stay, yet any non-compliance with the permitting requirements can be redressed by government oversight.
Label: Main

Sentence: Under such practice, a market entity shall be approved for business activities when it commits to complying with all the permitting requirements.
Label: Main

Sentence: A company violating this commitment shall see its license revoked and face heavy penalties.
Label: Main

Sentence: Improved access services will be applied to the government review items concerning public security and public health where notification commitment does not fit.
Label: Main

Sentence: However, efforts will be made to reduce the required materials, streamline procedures, and cut the reviewing time to keep the permitting process transparent and make market access easier for start-up and innovative businesses.
Label: Main

Sentence: "It is important to put greater emphasis on implementing new, intensified efforts for compliance oversight while easing market access in advancing the reform of decoupling business licenses and operation permits, and enhance fair supervision," Li said.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: The Wednesday meeting also decided to cancel the required production permits for 14 types of industrial goods.
Label: Main

Sentence: Production permits for goods relating to public security, public health and environmental protection shall be replaced by mandatory certification.
Label: Main

Sentence: A list of these products will be compiled and released to the public, and certification charges shall be funded by public finance.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: "This reform of decoupling business licenses and operation permits should be well-paced as realities differ across the country.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: The reform may move faster in places where conditions are fully in place, yet no one-size-fits-all approach should be applied," Li stressed.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: "This is another test on our ability to govern."
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: STOCKHOLM (Reuters) - Swedish Prime Minister Stefan Lofven lost a no-confidence vote in parliament on Tuesday, with the anti-immigration Sweden Democrats threatening to block any new government unless they are given a say in policy.

Sentence: There has been widespread speculation that Trump might oust Rosenstein, a frequent target of Trump’s tweeted criticism, after a New York Times report that he had made remarks about Trump’s fitness for office and offered to record conversations with him.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: Rosenstein traveled with Trump on Air Force One to Orlando on Monday, where the president gave a speech to police chiefs.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: Upon landing, Rosenstein was seen smiling and appeared at ease as he walked down the front stairs of Air Force One alongside Trump’s chief of staff, John Kelly.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: It was not immediately clear whether Trump and Rosenstein talked about the controversy during their 45-minute-long conversation on the flight, where Kelly and another Department of Justice official, Ed O’Callaghan, were also present.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: They talked about support for law enforcement officials, border security, crime in Chicago and “general DOJ business,” White House spokesman Hogan Gidley said.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: “The press wants to know, ‘What did you talk about?’” Trump said at the start of his speech after he thanked Rosenstein for being there and noted the intense media interest.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: “We had a very good talk, I will say.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: That became a very big story, actually.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: We had a good talk,” Trump said.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Rosenstein has denied the Sept. 21 New York Times report as “inaccurate and factually incorrect.” The article said that while Rosenstein had made the suggestions over concern about chaos in the administration, none of them actually came to fruition.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: As he left the White House for Orlando, Trump was asked by a reporter if he had any plans to fire Rosenstein.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: “No I don’t, no,” he said.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: Rosenstein oversees Special Counsel Robert Mueller’s Russia investigation.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Russia denies interfering and Trump says there was no collusion between his campaign and Moscow.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Slideshow (7 Images)
Label: NA

Sentence: Firing Rosenstein before the Nov. 6 congressional elections could have political consequences.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: Democrats believe it would raise questions about whether Trump would shut down the Mueller probe, which could energize their voters in House and Senate races.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: Trump told reporters earlier on Monday that he has a “good relationship” with Rosenstein.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: “I didn’t know Rod before, but I’ve gotten to know him, and I get along very well with him,” he said.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: NEW DELHI (Thomson Reuters Foundation) - India has launched its first national register of sex offenders in a bid to stem crimes against women as the country reels from a series of high-profile rape cases.
Label: Main

Sentence: The database will be accessible only to law enforcement agencies and not to the public, with 440,000 names registered, including those convicted of rape, gang rape, child sex crimes and sexual harassment, according to a home ministry statement.
Label: Main

Sentence: It will also provide their photos, addresses and fingerprints, without compromising “any individual’s privacy”.
Label: Main

Sentence: “The National Database on Sexual Offenders (NDSO) ... will assist in effectively tracking and investigating cases of sexual offences,” the ministry said in the statement late Thursday.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: The register comes as a spate of sexual assault cases have rocked the country, which was named the most dangerous in the world for women by experts in a survey published by the Thomson Reuters Foundation in June.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: Earlier this week, police arrested the principal and four staff members of a boarding school in northern India over the rape of a teenage student.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Police said they detained four male students for the rape, which left the girl pregnant.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: The school staff are accused of destroying evidence and covering up the crime.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: In southern Kerala state, protests and calls grew this week for the arrest of a bishop accused of repeatedly raping a nun over a period of two years.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: In August, police in northern Uttar Pradesh state rescued 20 girls and three boys from a home where they were sold for sex.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: That raid came just weeks after police rescued nearly 30 girls who were sexually assaulted and tortured at a shelter in Bihar state.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: PRIVACY CONCERNS
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: The urgency to establish a sex offenders register gained momentum following nationwide outcry over the rape and murder of a Muslim girl in a Hindu-dominated area of Jammu and Kashmir state earlier this year.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: The accused, all Hindus, are currently on trial.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: The case prompted the government to approve the death penalty for the rape of girls under 12, and also increase the prison term for the rape of older girls and women.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Despite various measures, India’s rape epidemic has shown no sign of dying down.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: More than 100 cases were reported daily in India in 2016, the latest government data shows.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: An op-ed piece in the Hindustan Times newspaper on Friday called the new sex offenders register “timely”, but worried the government could overreach and misuse data, and warned it “may tarnish a person’s life forever if he is reformed”.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: Jayshree Bajoria of Human Rights Watch had similar concerns, telling the Thomson Reuters Foundation that even a rumor could prove dangerous in a country where incidents of mob justice have spiked recently.
Label: Distant_Anecdotal

Sentence: “For any real change, the government must do the hard work of actually implementing the laws and policies” that were put in place after the gang rape of a young woman in Delhi in 2012 on a moving bus, she said.
Label: Distant_Anecdotal

Sentence: Bajoria urged authorities to focus on supporting and protecting victims of sexual assault to ensure they are able to report crimes and receive justice without facing stigma and harassment.
Label: Distant_Anecdotal

Sentence: Many countries, such as the United States, Britain and South Africa keep a record of people who have been convicted of sexual offences such as pedophilia and rape.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: The United States, for example, has an online database which is open to the public.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: It provides information including the offender’s photograph and address, as well as details of the crime.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: In other countries, such as Britain, the policy entails offenders registering with their local police station.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Key people within the community such as doctors, youth leaders, landlords are informed and police monitor the offender.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: WASHINGTON (Reuters) - The U.S. Supreme Court begins its new term on Monday in an awkward position, down one justice as the fierce fight unfolds in the Senate over confirmation of President Donald Trump’s nomination of Brett Kavanaugh to a lifetime job as a justice.
Label: Main

Sentence: FILE PHOTO: The building of the U.S. Supreme Court is seen in Washington, U.S., June 26, 2017.
Label: NA

Sentence: REUTERS/Yuri Gripas/File Photo
Label: NA

Sentence: With eight justices rather than the usual nine, the court was set to hear arguments in two cases as it opens its nine-month term, according to tradition, on the first Monday of October.
Label: Main

Sentence: Justice Anthony Kennedy retired effective in July, leaving the court ideologically deadlocked with four conservatives and four liberals on the bench awaiting the outcome of the Kavanaugh battle.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Trump nominated the conservative federal appeals court judge in July but his confirmation in the Senate remained in doubt over sexual misconduct allegations that he denies.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Unlike prior years, when a series of major cases awaited the justices, there are no blockbusters yet on their calendar.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Their first argument on Monday is a property rights case involving protected habitat for a warty amphibian known as the dusky gopher frog.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: The court’s previous term, which ended in June, included more 5-4 decisions than usual, with conservatives in the majority.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: These rulings included approving Trump’s travel ban on people from several Muslim-majority nations, prohibiting a type of regulation of anti-abortion clinics, and banning certain public-sector union fees.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: “After a term of challenging cases and issues, and an unusually high number of 5-4 decisions, as I see it, we needed our summer break,” Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg joked to an audience last week.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: For the current term that runs through next June, the court does have some important cases, though none yet of the magnitude of the biggest from the previous term.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: One case over whether a state and the federal government can each prosecute a person for the same crime could impact Trump’s willingness to pardon people like Paul Manafort.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: Trump’s former campaign chairman was convicted in August of financial crimes by a jury in Virginia and then pleaded guilty in September to reduced charges in Washington brought by Special Counsel Robert Mueller as part of an investigation into Russia’s role in the 2016 election.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Other cases include whether the U.S. attorney general has too much power in determining to whom the federal sex offender registry applies, and whether a state can execute a convicted murderer who, after a series of strokes, forgot the crime.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: A number of hot-button issues may still be teed up for the justices this term, including disputes the court did not resolve last term over the constitutionality of an electoral map-drawing practice called partisan gerrymandering and whether people who run businesses can refuse service to gay couples because of religious objections to same-sex marriage.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: “The real meat of the coming term is what’s in the pipeline,” Trump administration Solicitor General Noel Francisco said at an event organized by the Federalist Society, a conservative lawyers’ group.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Major cases making their way up from lower courts include disputes over various abortion restrictions in Republican-led states, whether a federal law against sex discrimination also prohibits discrimination based on sexual orientation, and Trump’s plan to restrict transgender troops in the military.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Even if only some of those issues come before the justices “we might be talking about this term as one of those blockbuster years that is comparable to what we saw last year,” Francisco said.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: WASHINGTON, Oct. 6 (Xinhua) -- Brett Kavanaugh, President Donald Trump's second Supreme Court nominee, was sworn in on Saturday evening, shortly after the Senate passed his contentious confirmation by a vote of 50-48 amid fierce partisan fights focusing on sexual misconduct allegations against him.
Label: Main

Sentence: COURT MOVES RIGHTWARD
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Hailed as a big political victory for Trump and the Republican Party, Kavanaugh's lifetime appointment as the 114th Supreme Court justice appeared to secure a solid majority of conservatives on the U.S. highest court for years.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Nominating Kavanaugh was the second time in two years that Trump has made a Supreme Court pick.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: The 53-year-old succeeded 82-year-old Justice Anthony Kennedy, who retired on July 31 after having served as a pivotal swing vote between conservatives and liberals on the nine-member bench for years.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: As a result, the court now consists of five conservatives and four liberals.
Label: Main_Consequence

Sentence: There will be no swing vote if none of the conservative justices move to the middle.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: The court "will perfectly reflect the deep polarization of the American public and political system," Adam Liptak with the New York Times commented.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: The rightward trend of the U.S. highest court is expected to have long-term substantial effects on many issues deeply dividing Americans, such as abortion, affirmative action, voting and gun rights.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: The Supreme Court decides matters that shape the U.S. politics.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: It is both the highest appeals panel and a constitutional court in the country.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: PARTISAN FIGHT
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: Kavanaugh was confirmed by a margin of 50 votes to 48 in the Senate final floor vote, the slimmest for a Supreme Court nominee in more than a century.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: Senator Joe Manchin, who was facing tough re-election campaign in red state West Virginia, was the only Democrat to vote for Kavanaugh's confirmation.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell said Saturday that the bitter partisan battle over Kavanaugh's confirmation has revved up Republican voters across red states.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: "Our base is on fire," the top Senate Republican said in an interview with The Hill news daily.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: However, Democrats also say their voters are now more fired up than ever to deliver a rebuke to the Republicans in the midterm elections, citing women's anger as a force.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: During the Senate final voting on Saturday, hundreds of protesters were demonstrating on Capitol Hill, chanting "November is coming" and "We believe survivors."
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Capitol Police said later in the day that 164 of them were arrested.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Amid partisan fights over the confirmation, three women came forward last month to accuse Kavanaugh of sexually assaulting or harassing them during his high school and university years.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Kavanaugh has denied all the accusations.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: The results on the upcoming midterm elections seem to be complicated.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: However, it appears the two mainstream parties in the country would continue fighting each other in a likely more polarized way, analysts say.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: COLOMBO, Sept. 28 (Xinhua) -- Sri Lanka and China will launch the construction of a state-of-the-art water testing laboratory at the Peradeniya University, in the central highlands of the island country to find a scientific solution to end chronic kidney disease of unknown origin (CKDu), Sri Lanka's government information department said in a report on Friday.
Label: Main

Sentence: Sri Lanka's City Planning and Water Supply Minister, Rauff Hakeem said the construction of the China, Sri Lanka Joint Research and Demonstration Center for Water Technology would begin on Saturday and will be completed by May 2020.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: The University of Peradeniya, Chinese Academy of Sciences and the City Planning and Water Supply Ministry are partners to the project, Minister Hakeem said.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Hakeem further said the project grant by the Chinese government was a result of President Maithripala Sirisena's visit to China in 2015.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: The project construction is undertaken by China Tiesiju Civil Engineering Group Co., Ltd. (CTCE).
Label: Cause_General

Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: TOKYO, Sept. 14 (Xinhua) -- Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe and former Defense Minister Shigeru Ishiba on Friday held a policy debate on a variety of pivotal issues as campaigning continues ahead of next week's Liberal Democratic Party (LDP) leadership contest.
Label: Main

Sentence: Abe, who if he wins his third successive three-year term as head of the LDP, will effectively become Japan's longest serving prime minister, pledged to address Japan's severe demographic issues, calling Japan's aging and shrinking population a "national crisis."
Label: Main

Sentence: He proposed to overhaul the social welfare system to allow workers who are aged 65 or older to continue working beyond their retirement age, as well as allowing people aged over 70 to chose for themselves when to start receiving pension payouts.
Label: Main

Sentence: Ishiba, for his part, highlighted the fact that the funding necessary for the country's social welfare system must be secured, and reiterated his stance on revitalizing regional economies as they could become potential new growth drivers.
Label: Main

Sentence: He said that he does not believe that big businesses expanding will have any benefit on regional economies.
Label: Main

Sentence: In terms of social security costs, the government has requested a record high budget of 102.5 trillion yen (916 billion U.S. dollars) for fiscal year 2019, with Japan's Ministry of Health, Labor and Welfare asking for 31.90 trillion yen (285 billion U.S. dollars), a new record high and a 2.5 percent increase from the previous budget, as it continues to grapple with swelling spending on welfare costs.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: According to the ministry, its expenditure is set to rocket to more than 32 trillion yen (286 billion U.S. dollars), up by about 600 billion yen (5.36 billion U.S. dollars).
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: This comes against a backdrop of various iterations of the prime minister's "Abenomics" brand of economic policies, yet Japan, the world's third largest economy, has a public debt amounting to 236 percent of its gross domestic product (GDP), which remains the worst in the industrialized world.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Ishiba, during Friday's debate, voiced his criticism of "Abenomics," which has failed to fix or significantly impact Japan's woeful fiscal health, while the Bank of Japan continues to struggle to definitively pull the nation out of deflation and hit its lofty 2 percent inflation target.
Label: Main

Sentence: As for other key themes, Abe said his career goal of amending Japan's pacifist constitution remained unchanged.
Label: Main

Sentence: "I'm determined to start a new era for Japan by tackling what we haven't been able to do for the past 70 years since the end of the war, a constitutional revision," said Abe.
Label: Main

Sentence: The prime minister wants to specifically reference the Self-Defense Forces in the constitution so as there is no ambiguity about their constitutionality.
Label: Main

Sentence: But Ishiba, who has taken a cautious stance towards Abe's plans, maintained that the Constitution should not be amended without a full and sincere explanation to the public.
Label: Main

Sentence: "It doesn't mean all is well as long as the SDF is written," Ishiba argued.
Label: Main

Sentence: He said that he disagrees with Abe's methodology of changing the charter and said they both remain duty-bound to present all the facts to the public as that is where sovereignty resides.
Label: Main

Sentence: He added that a more fundamental approach should be taken.
Label: Main

Sentence: On disaster prevention, as the nation has been battered by torrential rains, typhoons and earthquakes recently, Abe vowed to carry out emergency measures over the next three years to help prevent and mitigate the effects of disasters when they occur and improve the nation's resilience.
Label: Main

Sentence: Ishiba said that a dedicated government office that specializes in disaster preparedness should be created and overseen by a minister, with its staff in a state of preparedness 24 hours a day, 365 days a year.
Label: Main

Sentence: The LDP presidential election votes will be counted and the winner announced on Sept. 20.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: BERLIN, Sept. 19 (Xinhua) -- German intelligence chief Hans-Georg Maasen will be promoted to a more senior post in the interior ministry, the country's federal government announced on Tuesday night.
Label: Main

Sentence: The decision to relieve Maasen of his duties as president of the Federal Office for the Protection of the Constitution (BfV) and instead offer him the better salaried position as secretary of state for interior- and cyber security was reached during an emergency cabinet session.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: Earlier, the German Social Democrats (SPD) had threatened to quit the "grand coalition", formed together with the Christian Democratic Union (CDU) and Christian Social Union (CSU), unless Chancellor Angela Merkel (CDU) personally ensured that Maasen was sacked by Wednesday.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: The previously-little known national intelligence services executive, the former BfV president, has recently sparked heated public debate in Germany by questioning the authenticity of a video footage in which right-wing extremists were seen chasing and accosting stereotypically foreign-looking civilians on the streets of Chemnitz.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: In doing so, Maasen directly contradicted chancellor Merkel and local security officers on the issue before backtracking on the statement in question during a subsequent report.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: As a consequence, senior SPD politicians complained that the uncertainty created by Maasen and the resulting impetus provided to online conspiracy theories, as well as a growing impression that the BfV president has personal sympathies for the far-right, rendered him unsuitable for the task of protecting the German constitution.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Maasen has previously already been accused of offering clandestine advice to the Alternative for Germany (AfD) party on how to prevent its monitoring by the BfV, a claim he vigorously denies.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Nevertheless, interior minister and CSU leader Horst Seehofer, whose ministry is responsible for nominating the leadership of the BfV, insisted that his trust in Maasen remained intact.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: In his new role, Maasen will once again report to Seehofer while receiving a monthly salary of 14,100 euros (16,500 U.S. dollars) compared to 11,500 euros at the BfV.
Label: Main_Consequence

Sentence: The interior minister is scheduled to provide detailed information about the responsibilities of Maasen as secretary of state on Wednesday.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: CDU leader Merkel, CSU leader Seehofer and SPD leader Andrea Nahles described Maasen's promotion as a sensible compromise which would ensure the continued existence of the "grand coalition" and thus enable the federal government to return to its regular work.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: However, the unusual personnel decision in response to widespread allegations of inappropriate behavior was met with a wave of criticism in the German media, the ruling parties themselves and the opposition.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: The magazine "SPIEGEL" wrote that the final outcome and way in which a decision was reached in the affair offered an "exemplary case of how to promote frustration with politics."
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: SPD vice-president Ralf Stegner similarly told the German press agency (dpa) on Wednesday that the development was a "disaster" which would cause support in his party for a continuation of the "grand coalition" to fall even further to dangerously low levels.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: For Kevin Kuehnert, the leader of the SPD youth organization (Juso) and one of the most outspoken critics of Merkel, Seehofer and Maasen, the time has come for the party to exit Merkel's fourth ruling cabinet.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: Kuehnert argued in the newspaper "Rheinische Post" that the "price for the continued existence of the coalition is too high."
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: He lamented that Maasen's promotion was a "slap in the face" for everybody who had to shoulder the full responsibility for themselves and their behavior at work every day.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: The Greens (Gruene) and Left party (Linke) both attacked the move as a being a "farcical" solution in separate statements.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Free Democratic Party (FDP) vice president Stephan Thomae interpreted the surprising success of Maasen in securing a new government post under Seehofer as a sign of Merkel's rapidly eroding authority in her won cabinet.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: MOSCOW, Sept. 16 (Xinhua) -- Russian President Vladimir Putin will discuss Syrian issues with his Turkish counterpart Recep Tayyip Erdogan in Russia's Sochi on Monday, the Kremlin said in a statement Sunday.
Label: Main

Sentence: The meeting will take place at a time when the Syrian government forces backed by Russia and Iran are preparing an offensive against rebels' last major stronghold in Idlib province, although Turkey and the United States have repeatedly warned against any operation.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Erdogan's call for a cease-fire in Idlib, which borders Turkey, was accepted neither by Russia nor Iran at the tripartite summit in Tehran on Sept. 7.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Last week, four Russian warplanes stationed in Syria's Hmeymim airbase attacked militants in Idlib and the Russian Foreign Ministry said it was important and urgent to eradicate terrorism in Idlib.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Russian strategic bombers have simulated striking targets in Syria.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Turkey and the United States reject the possible offensive in Idlib, citing that it could cause great civilian casualties and even a humanitarian disaster.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov and U.S. Secretary of State Mike Pompeo are expected to negotiate over Idlib on the sidelines of the 73rd session of the United Nations General Assembly that will open on Tuesday.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: ADEN, Yemen, Dec. 13 (Xinhua) -- The Saudi-backed Yemeni government and the Houthi rebels concluded the UN-sponsored peace talks in Sweden on Thursday with an agreement on cease-fire in the flashpoint Red Sea port city of Hodeidah.
Label: Main

Sentence: They also agreed to withdraw the warring forces within days, a significant progress witnessed by the UN chief Antonio Guterres who participated in the Yemeni negotiating teams at the closing ceremony of the seven-day peace talks.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Guterres said what was done during the talks was an important step for the benefit of the Yemeni people.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: "You have reached an agreement on Hodeidah port and city, which will see a mutual re-deployment of forces from the port and the city, and the establishment of a province-wide cease-fire," he said.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: "The UN will play a leading role in the port," he added.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: According to a statement from the UN Special Envoy for Yemen Martin Griffiths, the parties reached an agreement on the city of Hodeidah and the ports of Hodeidah, Salif and Ras Issa, an executive mechanism on activating the prisoner exchange agreement, and a statement of understanding on Taiz.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: The two warring sides will be committed "to fully implementing the agreement and to working toward the removal of any obstructions or impediments to its implementation; and to refraining from any action, escalation or decisions that would undermine the prospects for full implementation of the agreement," the statement said.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: The delegations representing the two sides will be committed to continuing the consultations unconditionally in January 2019 in a location to be agreed upon in Sweden, it added.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: Yemeni political analysts and observers praised Sweden's deal and considered it a significant win for the exhausted Yemeni people and a key breakthrough for the UN-sponsored talks aimed at ending the country's conflict.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: But some fear the interpretation and the implementation of Hodeidah's cease-fire deal and other agreements will be likely more difficult than the announcement.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: Abdul-Raqeeb Hidyani, a political analyst and writer, told Xinhua that Sweden's deal was an important step in the long road of solving Yemen's complicated issue that caused these tragedies.
Label: Distant_Anecdotal

Sentence: "The implementation and the interpretation of the agreements in Sweden is the most important thing because many previous agreements failed just days after the signing ceremonies," Hidyani said.
Label: Distant_Anecdotal

Sentence: Nadwa Dawsari, a Yemeni researcher and conflict specialist, said it's too early to get excited about the new deal.
Label: Distant_Anecdotal

Sentence: "The devil is in the details.
Label: Distant_Anecdotal

Sentence: At best, it will lead to improving humanitarian conditions and easing some tensions, but it will be highly unlikely lead to ending the conflict," he warned.
Label: Distant_Anecdotal

Sentence: Yahya Abu Hatim, a strategic military expert and observer, said Houthis is likely the only side that benefits from the agreements.
Label: Distant_Anecdotal

Sentence: "The Houthis participated in the talks just to show themselves in front of the international community as a group that respect politics and that is not true because Houthis did not respect many political agreements in the past and only resort to military actions," he said.
Label: Distant_Anecdotal

Sentence: Sources confirmed that the withdrawal of the warring forces from Hodeidah will be conducted within 14 days in two phases.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: The two parties have been discussing the details of re-opening the airport in Sanaa, de-escalation measures in both Taiz and Hodeidah, and implementation of the agreement on exchanging prisoners, as well as the economic situation, Griffiths said.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Yemen has been mired in a civil war since 2014 when the Houthi rebels overtook the capital Sanaa and toppled the government of President Abd-Rabbuh Mansour Hadi.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: A Saudi-led coalition has been fighting the Houthis since 2015.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: The war has killed more than 10,000 people and created the world's worst humanitarian crisis.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: The latest peace talks tackled a wide range of substantive issues, with the aim of putting Yemen back on the path of peace, and alleviating the suffering of the Yemeni people.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: MOSCOW, Nov. 30 (Xinhua) -- Russia expressed disappointment at U.S. President Donald Trump's decision to cancel his meeting with Russian President Vladimir Putin in Argentina, saying that the move was a result of U.S. internal politics and lack of an agenda.
Label: Main

Sentence: "We regret the U.S. administration's decision ...
Label: Main

Sentence: It meant the presidents' discussion on serious issues on the international and bilateral agenda has been postponed indefinitely," Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov said Friday.
Label: Main

Sentence: On Thursday, Trump tweeted that considering the unsolved Russia-Ukraine confrontation, it would be "best" to cancel his meeting with Putin, which was previously scheduled for Dec. 1 on the sidelines of the Group of 20 (G20) summit.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Russia on Sunday seized near the Kerch Strait three Ukrainian naval ships that allegedly breached the Russian border, although Kiev denied the allegations.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: The White House reiterated Friday that the reason for cancelling meeting was Ukraine, adding that the ongoing Russia probe "probably does undermine" the U.S. relationship with Russia.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Despite Washington's repeated citing of the Kerch Strait incident, Russian experts believed that Trump used the tensions between Russia and Ukraine as a pretext for canceling the talks.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: "If one really decided to come to an agreement on something, this incident could not have prevented the meeting," Russian political scientist Mikhail Sinelnikov-Orishak told Xinhua.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Russian experts were skeptical about the meeting from the very beginning.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: No breakthroughs were expected due to U.S. internal politics.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: The fundamental difference between Russia and the United States in approaches to solving regional problems, such as the Syrian and Ukrainian issues, is another reason behind aborting the meeting.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: "A meeting between Trump and Putin is only possible with prior coordination of positions and an agenda, which will allow discussing various kinds of issues and finding points of contact," said Nikita Danyu, deputy director of the Institute for Strategic Studies and Forecasts of Russia's RUDN University.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: He noted that the only topic that could bring together the two leaders is global security, which includes Washington's plans to withdraw from arms control treaties.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: However, the Trump administration has little interest in these issues, according to Pavel Zolotaryov, head of the Military and Political Research section of the Moscow-based Institute for United States and Canada Studies.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: "U.S. President's National Security Affairs Assistant John Bolton is also not very inclined to deal with this problem, maybe only in the sense of getting rid of these treaties.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: He believes that the U.S. has no need of them," Zolotaryov said.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Despite disappointment, Putin is ready for dialogue with his U.S. counterpart, Peskov said Friday.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: LONDON, Dec. 12 (Xinhua) -- British Prime Minister Theresa May will face a vote of no confidence Wednesday from Members of Parliament (MPs) in her own Conservative Party that could see her kicked out of her role as prime minister and the Party leader.
Label: Main

Sentence: If that were to happen, May would still remain as prime minister until her successor had been chosen.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: That could see May remaining in Downing Street into January, with important government business effectively put on hold, and most significantly no progress being made on any Brexit deal.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: The vote of no confidence in May will be carried out by the so-called 1922 Committee, the representative group for Conservative MPs.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: The vote was triggered early on Wednesday morning when the necessary quota of 48 letters from MPs asking for a leadership vote was reached, which represents 15 percent of Tory MPs.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: If May can win the support of 158 Tory MPs, 50 percent of MPs plus one, then she can stay as leader and as prime minister.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: "May only has to win a simple majority in this no confidence vote in order to stay as leader," constitutional expert Tim Bale, professor of politics at Queen Mary University London (QMUL), told Xinhua.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: The rules of the leadership process state that the leader can face just one confidence vote in a year, so if May wins on Wednesday evening she will be immune from challenges until next December.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: However, if the vote is a close one May could feel that she is too politically damaged to continue, and she would step down as leader and prime minister.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: "You can win a confidence vote by one vote and stay in place, but I would suggest that that kind of majority would not be sufficient," Bale said.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: "It might be a technical win, but it would mean the Conservative Party leader is fatally wounded," he added.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: If May is defeated, or if she steps down as a result of the vote, then the Conservative Party will immediately begin the process of choosing a leader, who will become the new prime minister.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: The head of the 1922 Committee Graham Brady will agree a date for the first round of the leadership election with the prime minister.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: Then, candidates for leader will come forward from among Conservative MPs.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: Each candidate needs just two other MPs to nominate them for the election.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: This could see an initially large field of candidates running for leadership, and a series of votes will be held among Conservative MPs.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: In each round of the vote, the lowest polling leadership candidate will fall out of the race until there are just two left.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: Both those candidates will then be put to a postal ballot by the entire membership of the Conservative Party across the whole of Great Britain.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: Figures from March this year show that this electorate is about 124,000 strong.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: May went through the initial parts of this process in the summer of 2016 when she was eventually chosen to replace outgoing David Cameron, who quit the morning after the June referendum set Britain on a path to leave the European Union (EU).
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: At that time, the initial rounds of voting among Conservative MPs to reduce the field to two candidates took 10 days, and a postal ballot of party members was not necessary as the other candidate in the election with May withdrew from the race.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: The first part of the process, the voting rounds for MPs, could take the process up until just before Christmas.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: With the disruption of holidays and to the postal system, it would not be possible to hold a ballot of the full party membership until the New Year.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: LONDON, Nov. 16 (Xinhua) -- As British Prime Minister Theresa May appointed replacements Friday for the two front-bench ministers who quit this week, a leading expert in politics predicted she only stood a 50-50 chance of winning a challenge to her leadership.
Label: Main

Sentence: Professor Philip Cowley from Queen Mary University of London said those odds of success for her reign at 10 Downing Street are not such a good position for her to be in.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: As political commentators and parliamentary correspondents in London eagerly waited to see if a challenge to May emerges, the prime minster was busy at Number 10 hiring two new ministers to take over from Brexit Secretary Dominic Raab and Works and Pensions Secretary Esther McVey who quit this week from their government roles.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Both said they could not support the Brexit agreement agreed this week by the majority of May's cabinet.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Amber Rudd, who served as Home Secretary, essentially Britain's top interior minister, was brought back into the cabinet to succeed McVey.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Raab, who only took over the Brexit hot seat in July after the first holder of the post, David Davis, resigned, was succeeded by a politician relatively known outside the so-called Westminster bubble.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Health Minister Stephen Barclay was appointed to what political commentator described as the government job no politician wanted.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Former banker Barclay, who supported Britain leaving the European Union in the 2016 referendum, was appointed to the House of Commons in 2010, representing a constituency on Cambridgeshire.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: The main attention remained focused firmly on May with reports that the number of names needed to trigger a vote of no confidence in her had reached the minimum 48 required.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: In what is a highly secretive procedure, an announcement of a vote will be made at some stage, and result in a vote among the more than 300 Conservative MPs.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Professor Cowley believes a no-confidence move could even give May a boost if she wins the vote among Conservative MPs who sit in the House of Commons.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: "Even if she wins by one vote it would mean she could not be challenged again for a year," he said.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: Cowley, a political scientist, who has co-authored a new book, The British General Election of 2017, said if May lost the vote, or decided to step down if she won only by an insignificant margin, there would have to be a leadership contest to elect a new leader and prime minister, causing a delay of several weeks to the Brexit roller-coaster.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: May, he said, could be strengthened by the party's own rules which would prevent a second challenge for at least a year.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: "It would immediately mean that attack would disappear.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: At the moment May is facing a battle on two flanks, one in parliament and the other within her own Conservative Party.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: "If she won the vote of confidence by a big enough margin to carry on, and there has been talk of her winning by around 100, she would be at least able not to have to worry about another challenge from her own MPs."

Sentence: Cowley said one problem for May could be Conservative MPs who had not wanted a challenge in the first place, but who had doubts about her leadership, deciding that this would be their one chance to seek a new party leader.

Sentence: "My own hunch is that this would be a 50-50 chance of her winning this, and that is not a good position for a prime minister to be in."
Label: Main

Sentence: But Cowley said May, or a successor, would have to steer the Brexit measures through the British Parliament with one possible outcome a confidence vote.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: That, said Cowley, could see the Conservative government collapsing with a general election early in 2019 -- possibly around January or February.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: Such an election could, he said, see Labour's Jeremy Corbyn as prime minister of a minority government, bidding to negotiate a Brexit deal or an extension to the Article 50 process that started the ball rolling in the first place to end Britain's EU membership.

Sentence: LONDON, Dec. 2 (Xinhua) -- Britain could be plunged into a constitutional crisis if Prime Minister Theresa May loses her crucial Brexit vote on Dec. 11, a leading political academic told Xinhua on Sunday.
Label: Main

Sentence: Lawmakers will start a marathon five-day debate on Tuesday on the withdrawal deal agreed between May and the European Council a week ago.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: With up to 100 Conservatives MPs threatening to vote against the deal, it will plunge Britain's roller-coaster process of leaving the European Union (EU) into unchartered waters.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: So far nobody knows what will happen if May loses the vote, with leading politicians and political commentators putting forward a range of post-vote scenarios.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: They range from May seeking a modified deal from Britain, to her resigning as prime minister to let a new occupant of 10 Downing Street to take over the Brexit relay race, to a snap general election.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: Professor Anthony Glees from the University of Buckingham told Xinhua in an exclusive interview: "This is a political crisis which can, on Dec. 11, become a constitutional crisis if May loses, as all the experts believe she will do.
Label: Main

Sentence: If it is not resolved properly and quickly it will explode into a crisis affecting everyone in the UK, old, young, rich, poor, employer and employee, the sick and the healthy."
Label: Main

Sentence: The leader of the main opposition Labour Party, Sir Keir Starmer, said in a Sunday morning television interview that his party will call for a confidence vote in May's government if she loses the vote, with a snap general election a possible outcome.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: To add to May's political woes, opposition parties at Westminster are on the warpath over a government refusal to publish advice given about the Brexit withdrawal deal by the country's top legal officer, Attorney General Geoffrey Cox.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Cox, who wrote the advice, will make a statement on Monday in the House of Commons on the advice he has given, with only a summary of the legal advice published.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: The Democratic Unionist Party, whose 10 MPs give May's minority government its slender majority, has accused the government of having something to hide by holding back on the full advice politicians have demanded.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Behind the row over the advice is a suspicion by some politicians that it explains the arrangements in the withdrawal deal over the fate of the post-Brexit border between Northern Ireland and the Irish Republic.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: A permanent solution to maintaining a frictionless border between the two parts of Ireland has yet to be agreed by Britain and the EU.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: The fear among some politicians is that a temporary border arrangement, which May insists would only be for a short time, could be in place indefinitely as it would need approval from the European Union to remove.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: The Sunday Times claims in a major report that Britain would be trapped indefinitely in a customs union with Brussels if MPs back May's Brexit deal.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: "The government's top law officer ruled that the only way Britain could escape the backstop would be to sign a new trade deal, which could take years.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: But he warned Britain could remain trapped if those talks collapsed," said the newspaper.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: Its report claimed the details have been confirmed to the newspaper by three serving cabinet ministers, including the former Brexit Secretary Dominic Raab, who resigned recently because of his opposition to May's deal with the EU.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: On the last day of her visit to Argentina where she attended the G20 Summit, May said: "The next nine days are a really important time for our country leading up to the vote on this deal."
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: May has insisted she will press on with promoting her withdrawal agreement, saying it is the best deal for the country and respects the decision of the 2016 referendum when Britain voted to leave the EU.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: She returned to 10 Downing Street Sunday to prepare for what will be one of the most important and intense periods in British politics in a generation.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Meanwhile Glees, who is director of the Center for Security and Intelligence Studies at the University of Buckingham, said it seems inevitable May will lose on Dec. 11, with no more than 286 of the 650 MPs backing her, and the number of supporters decreasing on a daily basis.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: May's withdrawal plan, said Glees, is a compromise which has split MPs in the House of Commons because it pleases neither side.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Glees acknowledged that despite what MPs say, nobody can be sure how they will vote on Dec. 11.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: On the question of what will happen, Glees told Xinhua: "We are moving now into totally uncharted waters.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Mrs May will probably want to try again if she loses on Dec. 11.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: Perhaps a stock market and currency slump would focus Conservative MPs' minds on the need to support her a second time.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: Perhaps she would dissolve Parliament and have a general election."
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: Glees says his understanding is that May believes the British people voted to quit the EU and if she does not achieve this it will destroy the Conservative Party.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: In a reference to the long standing Eurosceptic wing within the Conservative party, Glees said: "The Brexiters have, after 40 years, finally won and May has to recognize that.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: At the same time, as a vicar's daughter, she genuinely wants not to harm ordinary British people."
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Glees said if it ends in disaster for May, and she faces a confidence vote it could lead one of her ministers taking over as prime minister.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: "Or there could be an early snap general election and a new Labour leader, perhaps with my former Brunel student John McDonnell (Labour's Shadow Chancellor) in Downing Street.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: "Britain could then enter a long period of political and economic decline, ending in state socialism in our country or a period of rule by experts and security chiefs."
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: However, it is also possible, believed Glees, that May will decide there needs to be a second referendum.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: "It is inconceivable that a government, or a political party that induced widescale economic collapse in the UK could survive," said Glees.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: UNITED NATIONS, Dec. 7 (Xinhua) -- UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres on Friday asked the international community to prevent rather than react to genocide as the crime does not happen overnight.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: "Genocide is deliberate and premeditated and requires serious preparations that take time.
Label: Main

Sentence: Those preparations should give the world time to act," Guterres told an event to mark the 70th anniversary of the Convention on the Prevention and Punishment of the Crime of Genocide and the international day to commemorate genocide victims.
Label: Main

Sentence: The Genocide Convention is preventive at its core, and punishes specific acts that are committed with the intent to destroy, in whole or in part, a national, ethnic, racial or religious group, he said.
Label: Main

Sentence: These acts include killing members of the group; causing serious bodily or mental harm to members of the group; deliberately inflicting on the group conditions of life calculated to bring about its physical destruction in whole or in part; imposing measures intended to prevent births within the group; and forcibly transferring children of the group to another group.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Preventing genocide means paying close attention to these provisions, said Guterres.
Label: Main

Sentence: "Tragically, the international community has sometimes failed to heed the warning signs and take early and decisive action.
Label: Main

Sentence: Rather than preventing genocide, we are still reacting to it, often too late."
Label: Main

Sentence: Since the end of World War II, the international community has failed to prevent genocide in Cambodia, Rwanda, and Srebrenica in the former Yugoslavia, he noted.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: In the past two decades, the world has at least started to hold perpetrators to account, he said.
Label: Main

Sentence: Local political observers pointed out that while Abe has secured the top party post for a third-consecutive term, effectively ensuring his position as the nation's next prime minister owing to the ruling coalition's majorities in both chambers of parliament, Ishiba garnering far more support than expected from rank-and-file members has certainly raised some red flags looking ahead.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: While Abe won 329 out of ballots cast by Diet members, and 224 by rank-and-file members, Ishiba secured 73 votes from legislators but an unexpected 181 votes from ordinary members, who closely reflect public opinion.

Sentence: AUSTIN, Texas (Reuters) - A Texas man who survived a deadly domestic attack hatched by his son is pushing the state to grant clemency to the condemned man, although it has never spared a death row inmate solely at the formal request of the victim’s family.
Label: Main

Sentence: Thomas “Bart” Whitaker is set to be put to death by lethal injection on Feb. 22 for masterminding a 2003 plot near Houston that left his mother Tricia, 51, and brother Kevin, 19, dead and his father Kent with a bullet wound near his heart.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: In the 31 states with capital punishment, district attorneys make the decision whether to seek death, balancing the punishment that they consider best serves society with the wishes of the victim’s family.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: In this case, the local Texas prosecutors pursued death and jurors decided Bart Whitaker, 38, deserved to be executed.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: His father, a 69-year-old devout Christian and retired executive, says if that penalty is implemented, it will only intensify his pain.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: “I am going to be thrown into a deeper grief at the hands of the state of Texas, in the name of justice,” Kent Whitaker said last week, after a 30-minute meeting with the chairman of the Texas Board of Pardons and Paroles in Austin.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: Whitaker says his son has been a model inmate and has provided letters from death row prison guards to back him up.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: According to the clemency petition, Kent Whitaker, his relatives and his wife’s family do not want Texas to execute Bart.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: The panel’s decision is due on Tuesday, two days before the execution.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: If it recommends commuting the death sentence to life in prison, Governor Greg Abbott, a Republican, would make the final decision.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: Tim Cole, an assistant professor of law at the University of North Texas Dallas College of Law and a former Texas district attorney, said the case points to a major flaw in the U.S. capital punishment system.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: With no consistent criteria for prosecutors on whether they should seek execution, he said, the system is arbitrary.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: “It is completely up to that one person, the district attorney, to seek death or not,” he said.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: The Whitaker case is an outlier, however.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: In many cases, family members want the district attorney to seek the maximum punishment, Cole said.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Since the U.S. Supreme Court reinstated the death penalty in 1976, clemency at the request of a forgiving victim’s family has been almost unheard of, according to the non-profit Death Penalty Information Center, which monitors U.S. capital punishment.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: It did happen in Georgia in 1990, the group said.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: It is far more common for courts to halt executions for reasons ranging from doubts over guilt to procedural problems with prosecutions than it is for a governor to grant clemency.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Money may have motivated Bart Whitaker to plan to murder his family with the help of two other men, court documents showed.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: One of those men, his roommate Chris Brashear, shot the father, mother and brother after the family returned from a dinner out.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: He shot Bart in the bicep to make it look he had also been attacked, court documents said.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: The two other men helped prosecutors pin the crime on Whitaker and were not sentenced to death.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: Local prosecutors said they considered the family’s views but stood by Whitaker’s sentence as appropriate for such a brutal crime.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: “We represent all of the community.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: It is not just one person we represent,” said Fred Felcman, first assistant district attorney for the Fort Bend County District Attorney’s Office.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: “Legally, justice says that he should be executed.”

Sentence: YANGON, Oct. 5 (Xinhua) -- Myanmar burnt confiscated ivory and wildlife parts in the capital of Nay Pyi Taw Thursday aiming to combat illegal wildlife trade in the country.
Label: Main

Sentence: The authorities ceremonially destroyed seized wildlife parts, including 277 ivory, 227 elephant and other wildlife bones, 45 pieces of different wildlife skins, 1,544 various horns, 45.5 kg of pangolin scales and 128 varieties of other wildlife parts with total estimated weight of 849.26 kg.
Label: Main

Sentence: The public burning, the first of its kind in Myanmar, sent a clear message that trade in illegal wildlife parts is unacceptable.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Noting that poaching and illegal trade of wildlife in Myanmar have been increasing, the Ministry of Natural Resources and Environmental Conservation said in a statement that "the confiscated items of wildlife were destroyed to raise public awareness for law enforcement on illegal trade of wild fauna and flora, for legal action taken against illegal wildlife, trading and poaching and for promoting international cooperation with Myanmar in fighting the illegal trade in wildlife."
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: "It is crucial to sustainably conserve our country's natural resources including land, water, forest, mountain and wildlife for the sake of our future generation.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: We designate and establish protected areas for biodiversity conservation," said Minister U Ohn Win at the wildlife parts destruction ceremony.

Sentence: Some 42 areas which account for 5.79 percent of the total land of Myanmar, have been designated as protected zones, he added.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Under the Conservation of Biodiversity and Protected Areas Law enacted in May, wildlife protection has been classified at three levels -- totally protected, normally protected and seasonally protected species.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: Elephant, tiger, leopard, gaur, bear, golden deer and pangolin are named as totally protected species.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Under the law, one can be sentenced to at least 3 to 10 years in prison with a fine if he or she kills or injures animals on the list of totally protected species, collects or trades their parts.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Illegal trade of totally protected fauna and flora will also be punished under the law.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: About 284 suspects have been arrested in connection with 140 wildlife crime cases since fiscal year 2016-2017.

Sentence: The wildlife crimes mostly occurred in Yangon, Bago and Ayeyarwaddy regions.

Sentence: The national wildlife enforcement task force, formed in 2016, has been implementing an action plan to combat poaching and illegal trade in cooperation with local and international organizations.

Sentence: Meanwhile, Myanmar forest authorities are conducting awareness campaign to stop shops selling wildlife animal souvenirs at pagoda precincts, airports and markets.

Sentence: CAPE TOWN, Sept. 11 (Xinhua) -- South Africa is among the countries that has the highest murder rate in the world, with 57 murders reported every day, Police Minister Bheki Cele said on Tuesday.
Label: Main

Sentence: Releasing his annual report on crime statistics in Parliament, Cele said 20,336 people were murdered in South Africa in the period from April 1, 2017 to April 31, 2018, up 6.9 percent from the 19,016 murders reported in the previous corresponding period.
Label: Main

Sentence: Of these murdered victims, 3,915 were women and children, the statistics show.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: Among the nine provinces, the Western Cape has the highest reported murder rate, to be followed by KwaZulu-Natal and Eastern Cape.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Seven of the top 10 police stations for murder cases are in the Western Cape where gang-related crimes are high.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: The province reported 808 gang-related murders in the period surveyed.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: Firearms were used in almost half of all murders, to be followed by knives, sharp instruments and other unknown items.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: Among other crimes, robbery of cash-in-transit vans also saw a sharp increase in the period surveyed, increasing by 86 counts, from 152 to 238, with most robberies happening on the roads and in business areas, and 40 in spaza shops and malls.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: In most instances, security guards' weapons were taken from them.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: Rape has increased by 0.5 percent, or by seven more people per day meaning that 109 people are raped every day in South Africa.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: While residential burglaries have decreased by 7.5 percent, this still means that 625 homes are burgled every day in South Africa.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: "This situation must be reversed with lightning speed.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: The worst thing we can do is come and give the same or worse statistics next year," Cele said at a press conference after releasing the report.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: He said South Africans should not have to adapt to dangerous conditions or "take it as a norm that when on the road, you must be hijacked, or when at home, someone must break in and terrorize you and your family".
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: It looks as if that South Africans are living in a war zone, when there is peace and no war in the country, Cele said.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: But Cele rejected the notion that the country has been plunged into a state of lawlessness.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: "We haven't reached a state of lawlessness in South Africa and we won't," he said.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: "I think our emphasis should be on what ought to be done rather than the crime statistics, which doesn't give any joy," the minister said.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: In response to the report, the opposition Inkatha Freedom Party (IFP) called for the reinstatement of capital punishment.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: "The deplorable state of crime in our country, particularly in regards to the murder rate is reason enough to get South Africans talking about the reinstatement of the capital punishment," said Narend Singh, a Member of Parliament from the IFP.
