Sentence: CAPE TOWN, Sept. 19 (Xinhua) -- Six key syndicate members implicated in a massive trafficking of poached rhino horns have been arrested, police said on Wednesday.
Label: Main

Sentence: The arrests were made on Tuesday in Mpumalanga Province by the Directorate for Priority Crime Investigation, also known as the Hawks, in cooperation with other law enforcement agencies, according to the South African Police Service (SAPS).
Label: Main

Sentence: The suspects, aged between 30 and 56, include two alleged syndicate leaders, two police officers and a former cop, SAPS spokesperson Brigadier Hangwani Mulaudzi said.
Label: Main

Sentence: They appeared at the White River Magistrate's Court in Mpumalanga on Wednesday afternoon, facing charges of theft, conspiracy to commit a crime, illegal buying and selling of rhino horns, corruption and money laundering, said Mulaudzi.
Label: Main_Consequence

Sentence: The syndicate members allegedly ran poaching groups with the support of corrupt police officials as well as authorities from the private game farms, Mulaudzi said.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: The expeditious internal disciplinary processes are already underway for the arrested police officers, he said.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: The logistical, transport and communication support of the criminal group was well managed and controlled and allegedly succeeded in moving rhino horns from the protected areas to places where the transactions would take place, Mulaudzi disclosed.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: The illegal transactions were also protected by alleged corrupt officials to ensure no detection from law enforcement, he said.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: The significant breakthrough followed Project Broadbill, an investigative operation launched by the Hawks in January last year, Mulaudzi said.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: The operation focused on the criminal supply chain of poached rhinos within the Kruger National Park and other state-owned or private reserves in Kwazulu Natal and Gauteng provinces.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Lieutenant General Godfrey Lebeya, the National Head of the Hawks, lauded the collaborative action as a huge success in the fight against rhino poaching in the country.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: "We have often been seized with picking up the remains of endangered species and not finding and arresting the poachers and traffickers behind the crime.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: "The operation spells hope for rhinos and other endangered species and we are fully committed to eradicating poaching and trafficking," he said.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Lebeya vowed to continue teaming up with key enforcement partners and government departments in carrying out crucial investigations and arresting those behind the slaughter of the wildlife.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: The operation is still proceeding, and more seizures and possible arrests are expected, he said.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: South Africa, home to about 90 percent of the world's rhino population, bears the brunt of rhino poaching, losing 1,028 rhinos to poaching last year.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: The government has warned that the country's rhino population will be close to extinction by 2026 if no effective measures are taken to curb rhino poaching.

Sentence: CANBERRA, Sept. 20 (Xinhua) -- Police in South Australia (SA) on Thursday charged Geoffrey Adams over the 45-year-old cold case murder of his wife Colleen.
Label: Main

Sentence: Officers arrested Adams, aged 70, at his home in Wallaroo, 156 km north of SA's capital Adelaide, on Wednesday evening and charged him with murder.
Label: Main

Sentence: Shortly after making the arrest, police travelled with Adams to a property in Maitland, 50 km south, where the couple lived with their two children at the time of Colleen's disappearance in 1973.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Footage captured by local news showed Adams in the backyard of the property with officers where he pointed to a concrete slab before becoming visually emotional.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Police on Thursday began work to recover Colleen Adams' remains from that site.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: "It doesn't replace Colleen but it's immensely important and we can't underestimate how important it is for family and loved ones," SA Police Detective Superintendent Des Bray told reporters.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Colleen Adams was last seen alive on Nov. 22, 1973, at the Maitland property where Geoffrey Adams claimed she left with an unidentified middle-aged woman at 7 a.m. local time having told him that she was leaving him.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: She was officially reported missing by her mother the following month.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: The case was declared a major crime in 1979 but police never made an arrest.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: SA Police on Sunday announced that the case would be reviewed as part of Operation Persist, saying that they "have not given up hope of providing her family with some answers about her disappearance."
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: "We have an open mind as to what's happened and how it's happened, but we are of the opinion she has been murdered.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: We don't hold out hope that she's just missing and will turn up," Michael Newbury, a sergeant with the Major Crime investigation unit, said on Sunday.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: The review led to a new search of the Maitland property using ground penetrating radar, resulting in Wednesday's arrest.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Geoffrey Adams denied any involvement in his wife's disappearance as recently as Wednesday morning.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: He will face a bail hearing at an Adelaide Magistrates Court on Thursday.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Interviews with more than a dozen residents, officials and experts show how multiple failures increased Mabi’s death toll: flood-control plans were delayed for decades; residents often didn’t understand warnings about the risks; and an evacuation order for the worst-hit area came just minutes before confirmation that a levee had failed.

Sentence: DECADES OF DELAY

Sentence: Still, calls to improve flood control date back decades.

Sentence: Early proposals, dating as far back as 1968, called for a river bypass and a weir, or small dam, to supply water to farms and reduce flood risks.

Sentence: Resistance from residents on the southern side of the Odagawa river over being cut off from groundwater stalled the plans, Takahashi said.

Sentence: And in the last 20 years, public works spending has declined sharply, falling about 60 percent nationwide from a peak of 14.9 trillion yen in the fiscal year ending in March 1999 to about 6 trillion yen in the current fiscal year, government data show.

Sentence: MAPPING DISASTER

Sentence: RIVER BEND, the United States, Sept. 15 (Xinhua) -- "I've lived here for 23 years and the water levels in this hurricane were higher than I've ever seen before," John Kirkland, mayor of River Bend, North Carolina, told Xinhua after Hurricane Florence made landfall nearby.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Standing in the town hall building in the center of the town, Kirkland said that half of his town is located in a flood plain and has been inundated by the rising water level.
Label: Main

Sentence: On one side of the town hall building lies a children's playground, with only the upper half of slides and swings visible above the water.
Label: Main_Consequence

Sentence: The town, placed among a network of waterways with easy access to the ocean, had attracted many who enjoy boating on the calm waters of Pamlico Sound, the largest lagoon on the U.S. east coast.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: But during hurricane season, this blessing turns into a curse, as the snaking rivers that hug the town with a population of 3,100 suddenly transformed into muddy pipes that flooded the low lying part of the town.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Kirkland said his home is also among the dozens of houses in the flood plain and has yet to return to his home since the hurricane hit.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: He has resorted to staying at the town's fire department for safety.
Label: Main_Consequence

Sentence: Driving through the drier roads of River Bend, fallen tree branches scattered the neatly managed lawns, with one as thick as a car wheel ripped from its roots to smash on top of a house.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Many wooden power poles were also knocked down by the strong wind, leaving bare cables lying on ground, spooking locals.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Kirkland told Xinhua that the worst times came on Friday morning, and although the wind died down somewhat throughout the day, heavy rain persisted.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: "About 40 percent of (the residents in) the town left before the hurricane, and among those left some are in need of rescue, which we have started," Kirkland said, lamenting that too many people shrugged off hurricane warnings to have put themselves in dangerous positions.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: "We tried to tell them; it's amazing people don't use common sense," he said.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: With the worst part was over, Kirkland hoped that power can be soon restored to his town, but predicted it may take longer than a week.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: "In past hurricanes, which were not as bad, it usually took three to four days to get the power back up.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: It may be longer this time," he said, indicating that the town hall is the only building in town with power.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: The predicament of River Bend was not unique along the coast of North Carolina and South Carolina, which were on the direct path of Florence.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: During a drive through the coastal region of North Carolina, Xinhua saw roads covered with leaves and branches that were blown off trees, large swaths of farmland submerged under water and gas station roofs that were tipped over.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Florence has caused at least 13 deaths in the Carolinas so far, with over 1 million households and businesses without power, nine airports closed and over 2,500 flights canceled through Sunday.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Despite slowing down after making landfall early Friday, U.S. weather forecasters are predicting prolonged rainfall and storm surges in the region, urging local residents to exercise caution.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: WASHINGTON, Jan. 8 (Xinhua) -- Last year will be remembered as the "costliest" one for the United States with losses from hurricanes, fires and freezes reaching a record 306 billion U.S. dollars, a U.S. government report said Monday.
Label: Main

Sentence: The United States had 16 weather and climate disasters in 2017 each with losses exceeding one billion dollars, the U.S. National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration said in its report.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: That ties 2011 for the record number of billion-dollar disasters for an entire calendar year, but the total cost shatters the previous U.S. annual record of 214.8 billion dollars in 2005, the agency said.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: At least 362 people died and many more were injured during the course of the disasters that included one drought event, two flooding events, one freeze event, eight severe storm events, three tropical cyclone events, and one wildfire event, it said.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Among the disasters are the western U.S. wildfires that caused damages tallying 18 billion dollars, which was triple the previous U.S. record, said the report.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: Losses from Hurricane Harvey, which caused massive flooding in Texas, exceeded 125 billion dollars, which ranked second only to Hurricane Katrina, the costliest storm in the 38-year period of record.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: Hurricanes Maria and Irma had total damages of 90 billion dollars and 50 billion dollars, respectively.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: Hurricane Maria now ranks as third costliest weather and climate disaster on record for the nation, with Irma coming in close behind as fifth costliest, it said.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: "Since 1980, the U.S. has sustained 219 weather and climate disasters that have exceeded 1.5 trillion dollars in overall damages to date," the U.S. agency wrote.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: "The 1980-2017 annual average is 5.8 events; the annual average for the most recent five years (2013-2017) is 11.6 events."
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: The U.S. agency also said that the average U.S. temperature in 2017 was 54.6 degrees Fahrenheit (12.6 degrees Celsius), 2.6 degrees Fahrenheit above the 20th century average.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: "This was the third warmest year since record keeping began in 1895, behind 2012 (55.3 degrees Fahrenheit) and 2016 (54.9 degrees Fahrenheit), and the 21st consecutive warmer-than-average year for the U.S. (1997 through 2017)," the report said.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: In fact, the five warmest years on record for the contiguous U.S. have all occurred since 2006, it noted, reflecting a long-term warming trend.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: MATI, Greece, Sept. 24, (Xinhua) -- Two months after Greece's seaside resort of Mati was engulfed by a devastating wildfire, which had claimed 99 lives, a distinguished Greek climate expert has warned of the risks of more extreme weather and called for actions to deal with them.
Label: Main

Sentence: As Mati's local authorities are still trying to heal the wounds of fire, Christos Zerefos, Supervisor of the Research Center for Atmospheric Physics and Climatology of the Academy of Athens and member of various International Scientific Committees, warned in a recent interview with Xinhua that the climate change will make us more often face extreme weather events, either strong winds or heavy rainfall.
Label: Main

Sentence: And he urged for actions by the end of this century to get Greece better ready for natural disasters.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: "If we do not take action at national and international level by the end of the 21st century, the cost of natural disasters in our country will amount to 700 billion euros (823.8 billion U.S. dollars).
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: It is twice the debt of Greece," warned Zerefos.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: As one of the experts Greek Prime Minister Alexis Tsipras turned to in the aftermath of the tragedy, Zerefos described the scenes in Mati, only 29 km east of Capital Athens, as a battlefield after bombardment.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: The signs of disaster are still visible, as hundreds of gutted houses are left in ruins and people are still accommodated at camps, according to Zerefos.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: The Greek prime minister has requested their scientific knowledge and experience for dealing with natural disasters and avoiding such tragedies in the future.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: One of the main causes of the fire, according to Zerefos, is that the firefighting forces did not manage to control it in the first five minutes, as strong winds were blowing in the area.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Another bad estimate was that the wind would change direction and that Marathon Avenue, where Marathon race was born 2,500 years ago, would serve as a natural obstacle to the blazes, something that did not happen.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: "In the disaster, except from the pine trees, more than 200 cars were also burned in the area.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: The burning of cars equals to about one and a half gasoline tank, explosions occurred and temperatures rose too much, having reached 1,300 degrees Celsius.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: So it was like a war, as if the area had been bombarded," Zerefos explained.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: For Zerefos, preventing such kind of disaster from happening again is also very important.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: "If we strengthen the prevention and protection mechanisms, a process that has already begun, this cost will be reduced to around 400 billion euros (470.7 billion U.S. dollars).

Sentence: PARIS, Sept. 20 (Xinhua) -- Over 40 countries in the Pacific Rim will participate in a mock tsunami scenario for September-November period this year to test their "tsunami decision-making procedures and communication systems and processes,", UNESCO (UN Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization) said Thursday.
Label: Main

Sentence: Called Exercise Pacific Wave 2018 (PacWave18), the 8th Pacific Tsunami drill "will simulate Pacific countries in a Tsunami Warning situation requiring government decision-making and community action, essentially all aspects of the Disaster Risk Reduction cycle," said UNESCO, a sponsor of scientific studies and exercises on warning systems for various types of natural disasters.
Label: Main

Sentence: Thanks to the PacWave18, concerned countries would have the opportunity to test new tools including tsunami wave forecasts that will allow each country to better assess its own tsunami threat, according to the Paris-based UN body.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: As part of the exercise, participating countries would select from seven different Pacific scenarios based on real events from the past and conduct at least a Tabletop Exercise within the period of September to November, it noted.
Label: Main

Sentence: The Pacific Tsunami Warning Center in Hawaii, NWPTAC in Japan, and the SCSTAC in China would send simulated warnings, which would trigger a country's tsunami response that would be evaluated by experts, it added.
Label: Main

Sentence: "The events of the 2009 Samoa Islands Region, 2010 Chile, 2011 Japan, and the February 2013 Solomon Islands tsunamis have increased our need to be more prepared for such events," said Vladimir Ryabinin, Executive Secretary of the Intergovernmental Oceanographic Commission.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: "This important exercise will validate the enhanced products for future official use by countries of the Pacific Tsunami Warning and Mitigation System," he added.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: About 76 percent of the world's deadly tsunami occurrences take place in the Pacific Ocean and connected seas.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Five deadly tsunamis have hit the region over the past eight years: Samoa and Tonga were hit in 2009, Chile in 2010 and 2015, Japan in 2011 and the Solomon Islands in 2013.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: CHICAGO, Oct. 2 (Xinhua) -- Political bias and partisan news reporting influence whether people indicate experiencing certain extreme weather events, a new U.S. study showed.
Label: Main

Sentence: The researchers surveyed 3,057 people in the U.S. to ask them about the extreme weather they had experienced over a five-year period.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: Participants were asked where they live and if they believe in climate change, human causation and the scientific consensus on the matter.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: The experts then compared these answers to official weather reports for that region for the same time period.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: Data about the weather was taken from the Storm Events Database compiled by National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration's National Weather Service.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: The data included droughts, floods, tornadoes and hurricanes.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: Nearly 22 percent of respondents reported experiencing a polar vortex; 41 percent a drought; 20 percent a tornado; 29 percent a flood and 17 percent a hurricane in the past five years.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: However the data shows that 21 percent lived in a county where a flood was recorded over the time period; 25 percent a tornado; 4 percent a hurricane and 4 percent drought.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: About 59 percent of respondents agreed that "there is solid evidence that the average temperature on Earth has been getting warmer over the past few decades."
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: Of respondents who agreed with this statement, 74 percent agreed that Earth was warming mostly due to "human activity such as burning fossil fuels."
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: "This research shows people's perception of extreme weather can be processed through partisan lenses," said Ben Lyons, a researcher at the University of Exeter and the study's lead author.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: The study found that Republicans are less likely to report experiencing a polar vortex, while those exposed to liberal media are more likely.
Label: Main

Sentence: Nevertheless, the weather sometimes can be so extreme that it overshadows personal views, the researchers say.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: They found that partisanship and media use did not affect the way people in the U.S. Northeast, where the 2014 and 2015 polar vortex events hit hardest, reported the weather they had experienced.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: Those who favored liberal news sources reported experiencing drought more often than national weather data would suggest they actually did.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: The study has been published in the journal Environmental Communication.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: BEIJING, July 19 (Xinhua) -- President Xi Jinping has stressed a people-centered approach to flood control and disaster relief work and urged all-out efforts to ensure the safety of people's lives and property.
Label: Main

Sentence: Xi, also general secretary of the Communist Party of China (CPC) Central Committee and chairman of the Central Military Commission, made the remark in an instruction on flood control and disaster relief work as rainstorms have hit many regions across the country, triggering landslides and flooding of rivers since July.
Label: Main

Sentence: Noting that China has entered flood and typhoon season, Xi urged Party committees and governments of related regions to firmly adhere to a people-centered approach, carry out rescue and relief work at full strength, minimize casualties, properly arrange people's lives in disaster areas and reduce disaster losses to the minimum.
Label: Main

Sentence: Since July this year, rainstorms have hit many regions, triggering flooding of rivers, including the Yangtze, Yellow, Jialing, Tuojiang, and Fujiang rivers.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: As of July 18, a total of 20.53 million people in 27 provincial-level regions had been affected by flooding with 54 dead and eight missing.

Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: Xi ordered local authorities of relevant regions to strengthen emergency duties, fulfill responsibilities, and refine planned measures to ensure disasters can be addressed quickly.

Sentence: WASHINGTON, Sept. 10 (Xinhua) -- Florence has rapidly strengthened into a major hurricane as it's approaching the southeastern U.S. coast," the U.S. National Hurricane Center (NHC) said Monday.
Label: Main

Sentence: The center of Florence was located about 2,000 kilometers east-southeast of Cape Fear, state of North Carolina, packing maximum sustained winds of 185 km per hour (kph), moving west at 20 kph, according to the latest advisory published by the weather forecaster.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: On the forecast track, the center of Florence will move over the southwestern Atlantic Ocean between Bermuda and the Bahamas Tuesday and Wednesday before approaching the coast of South Caroline or North Caroline on Thursday, said the NHC.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: Florence, a Category 3 hurricane on the Saffir-Simpson Hurricane Wind Scale, is expected to further intensify and remain an extremely dangerous major hurricane through Thursday, it added.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: The governors of South Carolina, North Carolina and Virginia have declared states of emergency.
Label: Main_Consequence

Sentence: "Now is the time for your family also to prepare and stay tuned for more updates," South Carolina Governor Henry McMaster said.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: "Plan for the worst, pray for the best."
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: South Carolina emergency management officials said they were "preparing for the possibility of a large-scale disaster."
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: About 750 National Guard members were expected on duty in the state.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: The U.S. Navy said all ships in Virginia's coastal Hampton Roads area were preparing to leave port for open seas Monday, according to reports.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: Heavy rain in the Washington D.C. area over the weekend has already led to flooding in historic Alexandria, Virginia, local media reported, and the U.S. National Weather Service issued a flood watch for part of the Potomac River.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Hurricanes reaching Category 3 and higher are considered major hurricanes because of their potential in causing a significant loss of life and damage.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Florence, the first major hurricane of the Atlantic season, was once a Category 4 hurricane last week, packing maximum sustained winds of 215 kph, before weakening gradually to a tropical storm, which regained hurricane strength Sunday morning.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Officials said the largest threat to life from hurricanes is not the high winds, noting that flooding is the deadliest result of these storms.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Current forecast models indicate that Florence could strike the Carolinas and enter central Virginia, possibly stalling and dropping more than 20 inches of rain in some areas.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: That will lead to widespread and dangerous flooding, inundation of roads and damaged infrastructure.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: Potential widespread power outages are also expected.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: The U.S. National Guard urged local residents and visitors to prepare for rising waters, flash flooding.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: Florence is one of three hurricanes churning in the Atlantic Ocean, along with Helene and Isaac.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: While Helene is forecast to spin to sea away from land, Isaac is a real threat to the Caribbean later this week, according to the NHC.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: In addition, in the Pacific Ocean, what's now Hurricane Olivia is forecast to approach Hawaii as a tropical storm on Tuesday.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: NEW DELHI, June 13 (Xinhua) -- At least 10 people were killed and several others injured after lightning struck them at different places in India's eastern state of West Bengal, officials said Wednesday.
Label: Main

Sentence: The lightning struck Bankura, Hooghly, West Midnapore, Birbhum and North 24 Parganas districts on Tuesday.
Label: Main

Sentence: "Yesterday lightning killed 10 people and injured several others in the state," a disaster management official said.
Label: Main_Consequence

Sentence: "Four people were killed in Bankura district, three in Hooghly, and one each in West Midnapore, Birbhum and North 24 Parganas."
Label: Main_Consequence

Sentence: On Tuesday the state received its first major spell of rain from the southwest monsoon.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: The downpour led to severe water logging and a delay in train services in Kolkata city.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: India's Meteorological Department has predicted heavy rain at isolated places in West Bengal over the next 24 hours, and has advised fishermen to avoid venturing into the sea.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: Last month storms accompanied by lightning and rains killed over 250 people and injured more than 400 in five states.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: MOGADISHU, May 2 (Xinhua) -- Somalia President Mohamed Abdullahi Mohamed has appealed to the international community to support efforts to help 500,000 people affected by the floods that has displaced close to 175,000 from their homes.
Label: Main

Sentence: Mohamed who visited Somalia's central region of HirShabelle to assess the impact of flooding on Monday said his government was taking action to address the humanitarian crisis caused by the floods.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: "We have formed a national disaster committee to respond to the needs of our fellow citizens who have been affected," he said in a statement issued on Tuesday evening.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Mohamed who led a high-level delegation, which included representatives from the UN and the AU Mission in Somalia to the city of BeletWeyne, said his government stands by residents affected by the floods morally and materially to deliver all the help that it can.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: The humanitarian crisis was caused by the Shabelle River, which begins in the Ethiopian highlands and flows through BeletWeyne and the HirShabelle state capital of Jowhar, burst its banks following the onset of heavy rains which began last month.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: According to the government, other states affected by the heavy rains include Jubbaland and South West state.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: The heavy rains and flash floods come only months after a devastating drought left over 6 million people in need of humanitarian assistance last year.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: Yngvil Foss, the UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA) deputy country director for Somalia rainfall in recent weeks, has been heavier than anticipated.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: "Initially, all humanitarian actors started responding with the means and assets they had available.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: In the past week we have been able to raise additional money to target assistance for food, water, sanitation and non-food items to be able to respond," Foss said.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: The UN has warned that the heavy rains were worsening conditions in overcrowded Internally Displaced Persons (IDP) settlements and displacing more people along riverine areas due to flooding.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: The settlements have limited access to hygiene facilities, thus heightening the risk of communicable diseases.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: According to the OCHA report, some 246,000 people are at risk of flash floods in Baidoa, Southwest region, while in Jubbaland approximately 28,200 people have been displaced by floods, which swept away home, shelters, farms and livestock.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: In Belet Weyne, more than 200,000 people are at risk of being affected by floods after River Shabelle burst its banks, forcing many to flee the town to higher grounds.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Meanwhile, a team comprising AU troops and Somali national security forces has evacuated more than 10,000 people marooned by the raging floods in Belet Weyne, HirShabelle state.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: "We are taking part in the evacuation of Somali people so as to rescue them from flooded areas and take them to a place near Eel Jaale far from floods," said Col Abdourahman Rayale Hareed, the Commander of Djibouti's Hiil 5 Battalion who led the rescue mission.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: The first former Guantanamo detainee to be tried in a civilian court was acquitted Wednesday of all but one of more than 280 charges of conspiracy and murder in the 1998 terrorist bombings of the U.S. Embassies in Nairobi, Kenya, and Dar es Salaam, Tanzania.
Label: Main

Sentence: The case has been seen as a test of President Barack Obama's goal of trying detainees in federal court whenever feasible, and the result may again fuel debate over whether civilian courts are appropriate for trying terrorists.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: The defendant, Ahmed Khalfan Ghailani, 36, was convicted of one count of conspiracy to destroy government buildings and property.
Label: Main

Sentence: He was acquitted of four counts of conspiracy, including conspiring to kill Americans and to use weapons of mass destruction.
Label: Main

Sentence: Because of the unusual circumstances of Ghailani's case -- after he was captured in Pakistan in 2004, he was held for nearly five years in a so-called black site run by the CIA and at Guantanamo Bay, Cuba -- the prosecution faced significant legal hurdles even getting his case to trial.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: On the eve of trial last month, the government lost a key ruling that may have seriously damaged its chances of winning convictions.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: In the ruling, the judge, Lewis A. Kaplan of U.S. District Court in Manhattan, barred it from using an important witness against Ghailani because the government had learned about the man through Ghailani's interrogation while he was in CIA custody, where his lawyers say he was tortured.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: The witness, Hussein Abebe, would have testified that he had sold Ghailani the large quantities of TNT used to blow up the embassy in Dar es Salaam, prosecutors told the judge, calling him "a giant witness for the government."
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: On Wednesday, when the judge's clerk asked how the jury found on counts 11 to 223, which were all counts of murder, the jury foreman replied, "Not guilty."
Label: Main

Sentence: Ghailani, who remains in custody, faces a sentence of 20 years to life in prison.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: The unexpected verdict by the anonymous six-man, six-woman jury came in the fifth day of deliberations.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Ghailani's lawyers -- Peter E. Quijano, Steve Zissou and Michael K. Bachrach -- had argued that their client was innocent and had been duped into assisting in the terrorist conspiracy.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: "This verdict is a reaffirmation that this nation's judicial system is the greatest ever devised," Quijano said.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: "It is truly a system of laws and not men, where, in the shadow of the World Trade Center, this jury acquitted Ahmed Khalfan Ghailani of 284 out of 285 counts."
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: MOSCOW – Aleksei A. Navalny, the opposition leader and one of the most prominent politicians to go on trial in modern Russia, used his first full day in court Wednesday to say that the trial would prove his innocence, even if the judge convicted him.
Label: Main

Sentence: The trial, streamed on the Internet, has promised to be an important touchstone in President Vladimir V. Putin’s long career, as prosecutors have not previously indicted a high-profile politician, but it has gotten off to a languid start.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: It began last week in the provincial city of Kirov, east of Moscow.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Within an hour of opening, however, Judge Sergei A. Blinov granted a request by the defense lawyers for an adjournment so they could better prepare for trial.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: They requested a month, he gave them a week and they appealed.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: A higher court rejected that appeal Tuesday, clearing the way for opening statements to begin Wednesday.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Navalny, who is a lawyer, spoke at times in his own defense.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: “I am certain my innocence will be clear to everybody who is present in this chamber and everybody watching,” Navalny told the court, according to a transcript posted by the Rapsi legal news agency.
Label: Main

Sentence: “To all those involved in the illegal investigation, sooner or later you will face a severe but just punishment.”
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Others who have challenged Putin have faced prosecution, most notably the Yukos oil tycoon, Mikhail B. Khodorkovsky, who remains in prison, but the case against Navalny is the first in post-Soviet Russia against a high-profile political figure.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Navalny is charged with embezzling $500,000 from a state-controlled timber company in Kirov while working as an adviser to the regional governor in 2009.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: Prosecutors initially dismissed the case, but federal officials revived it after Navalny became the most prominent leader of the street protests in Moscow last year.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: He used his first day in court for a flurry of motions seemingly intended to highlight the apparent absurdity of a 4-year-old case in a provincial city far from Moscow surfacing in the wake of last winter’s protests, but ostensibly unrelated to the street protests.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: A spokesman for the Investigative Committee, a branch of the prosecutor’s office, said in an interview in Izvestia newspaper that investigators had focused on Navalny because he was accusing state officials of corruption while claiming to be “clean” himself.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: The trial will resume Thursday.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: Kathryn Wasserman Davis, who contributed tens of millions of dollars to cleaning the Hudson River and promoting peace through an organization she founded when she was 100, died Tuesday at her home in Hobe Sound, Fla. She was 106.
Label: Main

Sentence: Her death was confirmed by her grandson Christopher Davis.
Label: Main

Sentence: Davis donated millions to Scenic Hudson, a group that works to clean the river and its environs, after taking up kayaking in her 90s near her home in Tarrytown, N.Y.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: In 2007, when she turned 100, she founded Davis Projects for Peace, which awards $10,000 grants to humanitarian endeavors around the world initiated by college students.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: About 600 proposals from students of the 90 schools associated with the Davis United World College Scholars Program have been financed so far.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: This year’s projects include an attempt to provide solar-powered lamps to an impoverished county in China.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: For her efforts Davis was awarded the Woodrow Wilson Award for Public Service.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Davis was also a benefactor of higher education, giving to Ivy League universities such as Harvard and Columbia and particularly to Wellesley College, her undergraduate alma mater, where she created the Davis Museum and Cultural Center.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Kathryn Stix Wasserman was born in Philadelphia on Feb. 25, 1907.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: She received a bachelor’s degree from Wellesley, in Massachusetts, a master’s in international relations from Columbia University and a doctorate from the University of Geneva in Switzerland.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: A lifelong globetrotter and a Russophile since her first visit to the Caucasus Mountains in 1929, she met the insurance investment magnate Shelby Cullom Davis on a train to Geneva in 1930.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: They were married on Jan. 4, 1932.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: Shelby Davis died in 1994.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: Davis is survived by a daughter, Diana Davis Spencer; a son, Shelby; eight grandchildren; and 11 great-grandchildren.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: She also owned a home in Northeast Harbor, Maine, and supported environmental charities there including the Maine Coast Heritage Trust.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Her grandson Christopher said that virtually all of the Davis fortune would be left to charity.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: JERUSALEM – Four young brothers who had fled the civil war in Syria were killed in a fire that engulfed four tents in the Zaatari refugee camp near Jordan’s northern border, the aid worker who runs the camp said Saturday.
Label: Main

Sentence: Kilian Kleinschmidt of the Office of the U.N. High Commissioner for Refugees said that there were conflicting reports as to whether the Friday night fire was started by a candle or an electrical short-circuit, but that he believed it was accidental, in contrast to previous fires that officials suspect were deliberately set to protest conditions in the camp.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: “This looks like a genuine fire,” said Kleinschmidt, director of the Zaatari camp.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: “This tragic incident highlights even more so how vulnerable the kids are in displacement and refuge.”
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Zaatari, the largest camp of Syrian refugees in the region, has more than 100,000 residents, nearly 60 percent of them children; more than half live in tents.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Kleinschmidt said the four brothers from the Mubarak family – Salem, 6; Mahmoud, 5; Yasen, 4; and Mohammad, 3 – had suffered burns over 80 percent of their bodies and died in a local hospital, two Friday night and two Saturday.
Label: Main

Sentence: Kleinschmidt said residents from the area of the camp where the fire broke out had stormed the registration compound Saturday morning to demand that their tents be replaced by the prefabricated units known as caravans.
Label: Main_Consequence

Sentence: After a series of meetings, Kleinschmidt said, his staff agreed to provide caravans immediately to about half the refugees in the area if they moved to a less crowded spot.
Label: Main_Consequence

Sentence: “We came to that deal,” he said.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: “The main thing for me was to keep peace there.”
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: PARIS – Five people were convicted Monday in Pristina, the capital of Kosovo, in connection with an elaborate organ-trafficking network that lured poor people to the country to sell their kidneys and other organs to wealthy transplant recipients from Israel, the United States, Canada and Germany.
Label: Main

Sentence: Organs sold for as much as $130,000 each.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: The defendants, all Kosovars, were tried before a panel of two European Union judges and one Kosovar judge.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: A special prosecutor for the union, Jonathan Ratel, called the case a landmark because doctors had been convicted.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Dr. Lutfi Dervishi, a urologist and the director of the clinic at the center of the trafficking ring, was sentenced to eight years in prison.
Label: Main

Sentence: His son Arban Dervishi was sentenced to seven years and three months, and Dr. Sokol Hajdini, the clinic’s chief anesthesiologist, to three years.
Label: Main

Sentence: Two other defendants received one-year suspended sentences.
Label: Main

Sentence: In addition to the five who were convicted, two defendants were acquitted of charges of fraud and abuse of authority.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: All had denied any wrongdoing.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: “The sole and driving motive for this exploitation of the poor and the indigent was the opportunity for obscene profit and human greed,” Ratel, the prosecutor, said Monday.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: “In every sense this was a cruel harvest of the poor.”
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: The case has shaken Kosovo, a mostly Muslim country of 2 million that broke away from Serbia in 2008 in the aftermath of the Balkan wars of the 1990s and has been struggling to shed a culture of lawlessness and corruption.
Label: Main_Consequence

Sentence: This month, Kosovo and Serbia reached an agreement that the Kosovo government hopes will accelerate its integration into the international community, including membership in the United Nations.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: According to the indictment in the case, traffickers in the network promised payments of up to $26,000 to poor people in Turkey, Moldova and Russia to persuade them to travel to Kosovo and donate an organ.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: They were asked to sign false documents saying they were donating to a relative for humanitarian reasons.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: Two dozen donors were taken in by the scheme; many were never given any compensation and were released without adequate medical care.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: The wealthy, ailing patients who were to receive the organs flew to Pristina for transplant operations at a clinic called Medicus.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: It was founded by a well-meaning European philanthropist who helped local doctors during the war in Kosovo in 1999, but prosecutors said it was later transformed into an illegal organ transplant hub by Dervishi, a surgeon and professor at Pristina University Hospital.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: Ratel said the Dervishis were aided by Dr. Yusuf Sonmez, whom he called a notorious international organ trafficker.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Sonmez is a fugitive and may be in South Africa, Ratel said.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: The big breakthrough in the case happened in November 2008, Ratel said, when a young Turkish man was found at the Pristina airport, weak and shaking, with a large surgical scar on his left abdomen.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: The man told the police that his kidney had been stolen.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: When the police raided the clinic, they found a frail elderly Israeli man who had paid $90,000 for the kidney.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: Petrit Selimi, the deputy foreign minister of Kosovo, said the verdict showed that the rule of law was working in the country.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: “Illegal organ transplants are a scourge of poorer nations from Kamchatka to Kosovo, and we will continue to chase criminals engaged in it,” Selimi said.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: Kodak said Monday that it would spin off its document and personal imaging units to its British pension plan for $650 million in cash and noncash considerations, a move that paves the way for Kodak’s exit from bankruptcy protection.
Label: Main

Sentence: Kodak had been seeking to sell off the two imaging operations.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: Two weeks ago, Eastman Kodak announced a plan to sell its document imaging business to Brother of Japan for $210 million, with the provision that it could revisit the deal if it could sell both units together.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Now the bankrupt film pioneer has struck an even more advantageous deal after a protracted sales process.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: More important, the pension plan will settle its bankruptcy claim of $2.8 billion, paving the way for the company to emerge from Chapter 11 bankruptcy in the United States.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: On Tuesday, Kodak plans to file a draft plan to emerge from bankruptcy.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: “In one comprehensive transaction, Kodak will realize its previously announced intention to divest its personalized imaging and document imaging businesses and settle its largest legacy liability,” Antonio M. Perez, Kodak’s chairman and chief executive, said in a statement.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: The company had filed for bankruptcy protection in January 2012 and has been selling off various assets since then.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: In December, Kodak reached an agreement to sell 1,100 digital imaging patents to a consortium of technology companies for $525 million, far less than expected.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: But as part of that sale, Kodak retained a license to use the digital imaging portfolio patents in its future businesses, and for those businesses that it is selling.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: Kodak is being advised by Lazard and the law firm Sullivan & Cromwell.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: MULTAN, Pakistan – An Indian man on death row in Pakistan for espionage has died after being attacked by fellow inmates, Pakistan’s state television said early Thursday.
Label: Main

Sentence: Sarabjit Singh, 51, died in a hospital in the eastern city of Lahore, where he had been in a coma for at least five days.
Label: Main

Sentence: Singh was convicted of espionage in relation to bombings in two Pakistani cities in 1990.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: His fate has been a source of tension between Pakistan and India since he was attacked Friday.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: In a statement, the Indian prime minister, Manmohan Singh, said he was “deeply saddened” by Sarabjit Singh’s death, describing him as a “brave son of India.”
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Singh, the prime minister, criticized the Pakistani government’s refusal to repatriate the injured prisoner to India for emergency treatment.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: According to the Pakistani police, Sarabjit Singh was assaulted by two prisoners as he left his cell at Kot Lakhpat jail, outside Lahore, to exercise last Friday.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: He suffered severe head injuries and was later taken to the city’s Jinnah hospital in critical condition.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: Singh’s Pakistani lawyer said that his client had previously spoken of threats from inmates following the hanging of Afzal Guru, an accused Kashmiri militant, by the Indian authorities in February.
Label: Distant_Anecdotal

Sentence: Singh was convicted of spying and for his involvement in a series of bomb blasts that killed 14 people in the Punjabi cities of Faisalabad and Lahore in 1990.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: In 2006, Singh’s sister appealed to Pervez Musharraf, who was then Pakistan’s president, to grant him clemency and repatriate him to India.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: That petition was dismissed by Musharraf and the Pakistani courts.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: Singh then wrote to President Asif Ali Zardari in July 2009, requesting a pardon on humanitarian grounds.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: BEIJING – Human rights advocates have accused authorities in eastern China of denying urgent medical care to the nephew of dissident Chen Guangcheng, a move they say is aimed at punishing the uncle for his continued anti-government activism abroad after his daring escape to the U.S. Embassy in Beijing.
Label: Main

Sentence: Family members say that the nephew, Chen Kegui, 34, has acute appendicitis but that prison officials are refusing to send him to a hospital.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: “We’re very worried for his survival,” his father, Chen Guanfu, said Thursday, speaking from the prison in China’s Shandong province where his son is being held.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Chen Kegui was sentenced in November to 39 months in jail for “intentional injury” after he was convicted of attacking a government official who had broken into his family’s home in the frantic search for his uncle, who, although blind, had escaped house arrest from a nearby farmhouse.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: Unknown to local officials, Chen Guangcheng had by then fled to Beijing and, later, to the U.S. Embassy, prompting a diplomatic imbroglio that complicated an official visit by then-Secretary of State Hillary Rodham Clinton.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: Chen Guangcheng, a self-taught lawyer who was once hailed by the state media for his advocacy work, earned the government’s enmity after he took on the case of thousands of local women who had been subjected to forced abortions and sterilizations.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: In 2006, he was sentenced to 51 months in jail on what supporters say were trumped-up charges; upon his release, he and his family were confined to their home.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: His improbable escape – by scaling a wall one night and crawling through fields to freedom – deeply embarrassed the Chinese government.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: After several days of tense negotiations last May, Chinese officials allowed Chen Guangcheng and his family to leave the embassy for New York.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: Chen, now studying at New York University Law School, has continued to press for an investigation into his mistreatment and to speak out publicly about what he sees as the lack of rule of law in China.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: The government’s response, he has said, has been an escalating campaign of intimidation against those he left behind in Dongshigu village.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: SEOUL, South Korea – North Korea said Thursday that its Supreme Court had sentenced a U.S. citizen to 15 years of hard labor for committing hostile acts against its government.
Label: Main

Sentence: Kenneth Bae, 44, a Korean-American from Washington state who ran a tour business out of China, was arrested in the special economic zone of Rason in northeastern North Korea in November after leading a group of businessmen there from Yanji, China.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: On Saturday, the North said it was indicting him on charges that he tried to overthrow Pyongyang’s government.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: On Thursday, the North’s official Korean Central News Agency said the Supreme Court had sentenced Bae during a hearing Tuesday.
Label: Main

Sentence: The court convicted him of “hostile acts,” a charge less grave than the original charge that prosecutors pressed.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: The crime of trying to overthrow the government could have resulted in the death penalty.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: Under North Korean law, Bae should be transferred to a labor camp within 10 days of the ruling.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: The ruling came amid high tensions between Pyongyang and Washington and could complicate Washington’s diplomatic balancing act as it tries to hold a tough line with North Korea over its nuclear program.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: South Korean human rights advocates have said Bae not only ran tours to North Korea but also was interested in helping orphans there.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: They said security officials in the North might have been offended by pictures of orphans that Bae had taken and stored in his computer.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: North Korea has often used the plight of detained Americans as a bargaining chip in its dealings with Washington.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Some were freed only after former U.S. presidents traveled to the North to seek their release.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: In 2009, North Korea arrested two U.S. journalists, Laura Ling and Euna Lee, who it said had entered illegally and committed “hostile acts.” They were sentenced to 12 years of hard labor, but were released five months later, after former President Bill Clinton visited Pyongyang, the North’s capital, and met with Kim Jong Il, the leader at the time.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: The North has been locked in a standoff with the United States and South Korea since detonating a nuclear bomb in February.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Some analysts say the nation’s leader, Kim Jong Un, might be chafing at his inability to shift those two countries, which have refused to offer the North aid in order to relieve tensions, from their tough stance.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: In January, Bill Richardson, a former U.S. ambassador to the United Nations, tried to see Bae during a private trip to the North, but he said the government had rebuffed him.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: ALBANY – In another setback for proponents of the natural gas drilling technique known as hydrofracking, a state appellate court affirmed the right of local governments to ban the process within their borders.
Label: Main

Sentence: In a 4-0 decision Thursday, the Appellate Division of state Supreme Court’s Third Department rejected an appeal from Norse Energy Corporation, which had stepped into the plaintiff’s role in a lawsuit initially brought by Anschutz Exploration Corp. against the Town of Dryden’s fracking ban.
Label: Main

Sentence: When the ban was passed in August 2011, Anschutz had approximately 22,000 acres of land in the Tompkins County community under lease for potential drilling.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: MEXICO CITY – Guatemala’s highest court on Monday threw out the genocide conviction and prison sentence of the former dictator Gen. Efrain Rios Montt, ruling to rewind the trial to its final days.
Label: Main

Sentence: The decision by Guatemala’s Constitutional Court is a dramatic legal victory for Rios Montt, 86, and a blow to human rights advocates who called his conviction a sign that Guatemala’s courts would no longer allow impunity for the country’s powerful.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Rios Montt was sent to prison immediately after the verdict on May 10 but was transferred to a military hospital three days later for medical tests.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: The decision means that he will return to house arrest, where he had been held since the case against him began in January 2012.
Label: Main_Consequence

Sentence: A three-panel tribunal found him guilty of genocide and crimes against humanity, and he was sentenced to 80 years in prison.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: But Monday’s ruling did not throw out the entire trial.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Instead, it rolled back the proceedings to April 19, when a complex decision by a pretrial judge sent the trial into disarray.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: The Constitutional Court issued several confusing rulings that the trial judges interpreted to allow them to continue the proceedings.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: Legal experts said it was unlikely that the final days of the trial would be repeated because that would amount to a form of double jeopardy for the former dictator.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Rios Montt was found to be responsible for a series of massacres and rapes and the forced displacement of the Maya-Ixil ethnic group during his 17-month rule in 1982 and 1983.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: During a month of prosecution testimony, the court heard wrenching descriptions by survivors of the army’s scorched-earth policy through the hamlets of the Mayan highlands.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: His co-defendant, Gen. Jose Mauricio Rodriguez Sanchez, was acquitted.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: The constitutional court’s ruling effectively throws out his acquittal, and it is unclear whether he will be rearrested.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: The attorney general’s office is expected to appeal the court’s 3-2 ruling on Tuesday.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: Although the verdict was celebrated by international human rights organizations, it was controversial in Guatemala.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: The Constitutional Court was the target of a lobbying campaign by opponents of the verdict as it considered several defense injunctions it had failed to rule on during the trial.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Perhaps the most important campaign was by Guatemala’s powerful business federation, known as Cacif for the initials of its Spanish name.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Representing the country’s deeply conservative oligarchy, Cacif urged the court to overturn the verdict.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: The court “has the power in its hands to contribute to the governability and assure an effective rule of law,” the business group said.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: DHAKA, Bangladesh - A factory building that collapsed last month outside Dhaka, killing more than 1,000 workers in the deadliest disaster in the history of the garment industry, was constructed with substandard materials and in blatant disregard for building codes, a high-level government report issued Wednesday concluded.
Label: Main

Sentence: The 400-page report on the collapse of the Rana Plaza building in Savar, an industrial suburb of Dhaka, the capital, found widespread fault for the April 24 disaster, which killed 1,127 people.
Label: Main

Sentence: It blamed the mayor for wrongly granting construction approvals and recommended charges for the building’s owner, Sohel Rana, as well for as the owners of the five garment factories in the building, that could result in life sentences if they are convicted.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: The factory owners urged workers to return to their jobs despite evidence that the building was unsafe, the report said.
Label: Main

Sentence: “They compelled them to start,” said Main Uddin Khandaker, a high-ranking official in Bangladesh’s Home Ministry, who led the investigation.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: The Rana Plaza disaster has focused global attention on unsafe conditions in the garment industry in Bangladesh, which is now the world’s second-leading exporter of clothing, trailing only China.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Bangladesh has more than 5,000 garment factories, handling orders for nearly all of the world’s top brands and retailers.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: It has become an export powerhouse largely by delivering lower costs, in part by having the lowest wages in the world for garment workers.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Rana Plaza was a disaster waiting to happen, the government report suggested.
Label: Main

Sentence: Rana illegally constructed upper floors to house garment factories employing several thousand workers, it said.
Label: Main

Sentence: Large power generators placed on these upper floors, necessary because of regular power failures, would shake the poorly constructed building whenever they were switched on, according to the report.
Label: Main

Sentence: On April 23, cracks had appeared in the building, shaking the structure enough that many workers fled.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: An engineer called to inspect the structure warned that it was unsafe.
Label: Distant_Anecdotal

Sentence: Yet Rana and the factory bosses discounted any concerns and ordered their workers into the building the next morning, the government report concluded.
Label: Main

Sentence: A generator soon switched on, and the building buckled and collapsed, in what became a scene of horror.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: Khandaker’s report recommended that Rana and the factory owners be charged with culpable homicide.
Label: Main

Sentence: He also suggested that Rana had bribed local officials for construction approvals.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: BEIJING – A North Korean envoy visiting China said his country would “accept the proposal” by Chinese officials to open up dialogue, the China News Service reported Thursday, a possible signal that the North would agree to talks on its nuclear program.
Label: Main

Sentence: The comments were reported after the envoy, Marshal Choe Ryong-hae, met Liu Yunshan, who is a member of the Communist Party Standing Committee and the politician who heads ideological affairs for the Communist Party.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Liu was quoted as repeating a frequent appeal by China for a resumption of talks that would result in the removal of nuclear weapons from the Korean Peninsula “as soon as possible.”
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Few diplomats believe that the North is prepared to be involved in so-called six-party talks that aim to strip North Korea of its nuclear weapons.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: The international six-party talks on the North’s nuclear program – involving the United States, North Korea, South Korea, China, Japan and Russia – collapsed in 2008 after North Korea walked out, but the United States has been pushing in recent weeks for them to be restarted.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: China is North Korea’s biggest benefactor, but relations have been strained in recent months.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Experts say the North bridles at China’s stiff demands for low-priced natural resources, and that Chinese officials are annoyed by the North’s defiance of entreaties to refrain from missile and nuclear tests, the lastest of which was conducted in February.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: The visit by Choe, a close aide to the North’s new leader, Kim Jong Un, was seen by many analysts as a fence-mending mission.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: Choe, 72, was quoted by the China News Service as being “highly” appreciative of “China’s huge efforts to maintain peace and stability” on the Korean Peninsula.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: There have been no reports so far of Choe meeting with senior Chinese officials involved in foreign policy and military affairs.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: The publicized meetings have been with senior officials of the Communist Party who are the usual interlocutors with North Korea.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: On Wednesday, Choe met with Wang Jiarui, head of the International Department of the Communist Party of China.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: The North Korean news agency said Choe visited an industrial park in Beijing on Thursday.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: China’s basic advice to North Korea has been that it should reform its economy following the path of Deng Xiaoping, with special economic zones and some private enterprise.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Although North Korea has sometimes embarked on such reforms, the government has later pulled back, perhaps for fear of losing control in one of the world’s most tightly controlled countries.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: North Korean experts in China say they detect little change in China’s underlying policy of supporting North Korea.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: But the Chinese leadership would like North Korea to modify its erratic behavior, stop nuclear tests and halt its missile program, they say.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: How to reach that goal with Kim has not been resolved, some of the analysts said.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: The marshal’s visit came just days after the announcement that President Xi Jingping of China and President Barack Obama intended to meet in California next month, suggesting that the North was concerned that its recent actions had pushed China and the United States closer.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: Wang Gunsheng, an analyst at the Chinese Academy of Social Sciences, said the visit of Choe could be interpreted as a “kind of apology” by North Korea for its recent behavior.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: ISTANBUL - Turkish police Saturday used water cannons to scatter thousands of people who had gathered in Taksim Square here to commemorate four people killed during the nationwide anti-government protests that have gripped Turkey for more than two weeks.
Label: Main

Sentence: Representatives of the peaceful protesters read a statement of their demands before turning to Gezi Park, the center of a campaign to save the only green patch in Istanbul’s center.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: But that environmental campaign has quickly blossomed into a protest against Prime Minister Recep Tayyip Erdogan’s autocratic and dismissive reaction toward the protesters.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: A few activists, representing Taksim Solidarity, an umbrella group, left red carnations at the entrance to Gezi Park, which has been blocked by the police since last Saturday.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Some members of the crowd threw carnations at police vehicles or attached them to their wired windows.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: The police warned the crowd to disperse, but the protesters refused to leave Taksim Square and chanted anti-government slogans.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: Dozens of police officers then moved toward the crowd and began spraying the protesters with water cannons.
Label: Main

Sentence: For the first time in more than 20 days, the police did not use tear gas to force protesters away from Taksim Square.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: But the police did fire it at protesters on some side streets and at least one entrance to the square.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: “I was not standing on the road, which the police asked us to clear, so I thought I should be fine,” Gonul Duzer, a 24-year-old student, said as she held red carnations in her hand.
Label: Distant_Anecdotal

Sentence: “I wanted to hand these to them, but instead they pushed me away with their shields and said our right to protest was over.”
Label: Distant_Anecdotal

Sentence: Demonstrators and passers-by sought shelter in nearby cafes that sealed off their windows, in case the police used tear gas, and emptied terraces overlooking the square.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: On Saturday, Erdogan claimed that the protests were carried out “with malicious intentions.”
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: “You became the pawns in a dirty game and were deceived gravely,” he said, according to the semiofficial Anatolian news agency, referring to young activists who have been attending protests in more than 60 cities.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: “Nobody but God will have the power to overthrow our government,” Erdogan said at a rally in Samsun, a town on the Black Sea coast.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: JERUSALEM - President Mahmoud Abbas of the Palestinian Authority on Sunday accepted the resignation of his prime minister, Rami Hamdallah, who had asked to quit two weeks after being sworn into office.
Label: Main

Sentence: The latest power struggles in the West Bank, where the Palestinian Authority exercises limited self-rule, deepened the image of political disarray, days before Secretary of State John Kerry was expected back in the region to try to revive peace talks with Israel.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: But in what appeared to be an effort to project a minimal level of stability, a spokesman for Abbas told the official Palestinian news agency Wafa that Abbas asked Hamdallah to stay on in a caretaker role until a replacement could be found.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Hamdallah had replaced Salam Fayyad, an internationally respected economist who served as prime minister for six years.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: Fayyad quit in April, partly because of a dispute over his powers, but he stayed on as a caretaker until Hamdallah’s appointment.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: Palestinian officials said that Hamdallah had resigned because of a conflict over his authority and responsibilities, and they suggested that his primary problem was with his two deputy prime ministers.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: A university dean and professor of linguistics, Hamdallah took office with no experience in politics or government, but he was known to be close to Fatah, Abbas’ mainstream party.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: When Hamdallah was tapped for the post of prime minister, some Palestinian analysts said they expected him to be compliant and not clash with Abbas, an assumption that made Hamdallah’s swift resignation all the more surprising.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: Mahdi Abdul Hadi, the director of the Palestinian Academic Society for the Study of International Affairs, an independent research institute in East Jerusalem, said the Palestinian Authority was at “a real impasse,” stuck between the Israeli occupation and halfhearted efforts to reconcile with Hamas, the rival Islamic group that controls the coastal Palestinian territory of Gaza.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: “It is not a question of who the prime minister is,” Abdul Hadi said, “but of where the Palestinian Authority is heading.”
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: The Palestinian public, which reacted largely with apathy to the political disarray, found some unifying cheer this weekend after a singer from Gaza, Muhammad Assaf, 23, won the title of “Arab Idol” in a popular, pan-Arab singing contest fashioned on the British and U.S. versions.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Marc Rich, the former fugitive oil trader and founder of the commodities trading giant Glencore International, died on Wednesday in Lucerne, Switzerland.
Label: Main

Sentence: He was 78.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: The cause was a brain stroke at a hospital, according to a statement from his spokesman.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: Rich courted controversy throughout his colorful career, and was indicted by the U.S. in the early 1980s on charges of tax evasion and illegally trading with Iran.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: After being one of the country’s most famous fugitives for the next two decades, Rich eventually received a pardon from President Bill Clinton on his last day in office in early 2001.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: The pardon brought the oil trader back into the headlines after it was revealed that Rich’s former wife, Denise Eisenberg, had given donations to the Democratic Party in 2000, according to official records.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: Despite his notoriety, Rich, whose net worth was estimated at $2.5 billion, continued to work in the commodities industry, and founded Marc Rich & Co., the precursor of Glencore International, the commodities trader, which he later sold to the company’s management team in 1993.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: Rich was born in Antwerp, Belgium, but moved to New York with his family to escape the rise of the Nazis in Germany.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: He began his career as a metals trader in the early 1970s, and gained prominence during the 1973-74 oil crisis when he circumvented the Arab oil embargo to sell oil to U.S. companies in desperate need of supplies at increasingly high prices.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: He continued to buy oil from Iran after the country’s 1979 Islamic revolution despite U.S. sanctions against the country, and remained unapologetic about his activities.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: “They respected the contracts,” Rich told Daniel Ammann, a Swiss journalist, in 2009, in reference to Iran’s national oil company.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: “We performed a service for them.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: We bought the oil, we handled the transport and we sold it.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: They couldn’t do it themselves, so we were able to do it.”
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: His clients also included the apartheid regime of South Africa and the Sandinista government in Nicaragua.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: From 1973, Rich was similarly one of Israel’s most important oil suppliers for more than 20 years, and he held Israeli, Spanish and Belgian citizenship by the end of his life.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: In 1983, he fled from the U.S. to Switzerland after he was indicted on charges of fraud, trading with Iran and evading almost $50 million in taxes.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: All told, the offenses would have led to more than 300 years in prison.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: Over the years, Rich claimed that U.S. authorities had attempted several times to bring him to justice, including a plan, which was never carried out, to use a helicopter in Switzerland to capture him, according to a book published by Ammann in 2009.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: After leaving the U.S. and renouncing his citizenship, Rich sold many of his domestic business interests, including 20th Century Fox to Rupert Murdoch for $250 million in 1984.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: Glencore, the commodities company he founded, recently acquired the mining company Xstrata for around $30 billion, and has become a global giant in a number of commodities, including oil, iron ore and coal.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: “We are saddened to hear of the death of Marc.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: He was a friend and one of the great pioneers of the commodities trading industry,” Glencore-Xstrata’s current chief executive, Ivan Glasenberg, said in a statement.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: “Our deepest sympathies and condolences are with his family at this time.”
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: He is expected to be buried in Israel on Thursday.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: He is survived by two daughters, Ilona Schacter-Rich and Danielle Kilstock Rich.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: His victim, Felecia Prechtl, 29, was a single mother with a 5-year-old son.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: Eleven years after he was convicted of capital murder, Chamberlain, 37, was strapped to a gurney in Texas’ execution chamber at the Walls Unit prison here and was asked by a warden if he had any last words.

Sentence: “Thank you for being here today to honor Felecia Prechtl, whom I didn’t even know,” he told her son, parents and brother on June 11, 2008.

Sentence: The state with the busiest death chamber in America publishes the final statements of the inmates it has executed on a prison agency website, a kind of public catalog of the rantings, apologies, prayers, claims of innocence and confessions of hundreds of men and women in the minutes before their deaths.

Sentence: The state’s execution record has often been criticized.

Sentence: But three decades of last statements by inmates reveal a glimmer of the humanity behind those anonymous numbers.
